description:
Diane, the shop owner is quite simply wonderful! First time visiting her shop.

I walked in and she recommended a cocktail bun, which at other shops is a staple and what I would go for.

I lacked enough cash to buy an array of her baked goods. I normally have some emergency cash in my backpack but searched and couldn't find it. 

(Only had credit cards on me) Barely had enough pocket change to buy a banana muffin $.85 cents. She accepts what little I had, and goes above and beyond!

Gives me the Cocktail bun at no extra charge! I offer to pay her for this next time I visit (and I will). She graciously declines. "Don't worry about it she says." Such a generous person!

Diana, you now have a customer for life!
You rock!!!
author: Sammy L.

description:
So I waited in line at Golden Gate Bakery for 20 min to get to the door only to see they don't have egg tarts that day.  UGH!  And every other pastry was a moon cake (it was Mid-Autumn Festival time).  My friend tells me we should go to his favorite bakery.  I don't want to drive all the way to The Sunset (where he used to live for quite some time) but I say ok anyway.

Great decision!  There are a large variety of pastries and buns at this small bakery.  The prices here are super reasonable as well.  Each egg custard was $1 and the were quite tasty.  Super creamy with a crispy flaky shell.  I even ate one the next day and it was still really good.  I do have to give a shout out to the wintermelon cake (sweetheart/wife cake).  Probably the best bite out of all the things I bought.  

The girl behind the counter was really patient with me and I appreciate that.  I was trying to get as much as I could knowing I would have to fly with it. 

Be aware they only take cash.
author: Christina R.

description:
Got a poppyseed muffin ($.80), a pineapple bun ($.90), and an almond cookie ($1.30). 

The poppyseed muffin: 3 stars. Was moist but not as strongly poppy flavored as what you would get typically (perhaps from Sprouts, Trader Joes or Panera). 

Almond cookie: 4 stars. Soft like cake inside. Huge cookie. Tasted fine.

Pineapple bun: 4 stars. Soft bread inside (better than Kee Wah and most chain bakeries I've recently tried), large bun, nice crumbly sweet crust. 

I think it's a really nice convenient place to go for a snack if you're on the go and hungry. I came around 1:30 pm on a Monday, and it was a quick, nice purchase.
author: Jill F.

description:
Very friendly proprietor was patient with me as I asked questions. 

The chicken pie $1.20 had a nice flaky crust and very substantial pieces of chicken. The crust is a bit sweet, which was a bit weird. Sheng Kee sells a $1.80 chicken pie with a better full puff crust but substantially less filling. I wish I could combine this filling with Sheng Kee's crust. 

The beef curry horn $1.50 also had a flaky crust and was filled with delicious curry beef. Sheng Kee's is also $1.50 and is substantially smaller. Again I wish I had have Sheng Kee's crust with this filling. 

Rounded it out with an adorable mini mocha roll, $1

I prefer the pastry at Sheng Kee, which is a full puff pastry rather than the rough puff pastry here. But the portions at Sunset are much larger, the fillings more substantial, and the price is much lower!
author: Julia C.

description: Could have put more strawberries in the cake I bought. Half sheet= $75. Also it was an extra charge to put the type of flowers I wanted as the design. Instead I got the free flowers he was able to design. all in all, it was a reasonable price. No one complained about the cake!
author: Nezelle A.

description:
All stars for value. $22 for a strawberry, mixed fruit, or mocha cake. You can ask for writing on it and she let me see it before boxing it up. Mocha cake looks pretty. Also Possible to get a plain white simple 3 tier wedding cake for $600. Pastries are ok. 
Friendly staff. Humble neighborhood bakery.
author: Veranna N.

description:
Five stars for taste. I usually don't like cake at all but this one was very fluffy and light. I ordered a chocolate cake with chocolate cream feeling and "white cream frosting" (which was whipped cream). It worked perfectly.

Fruit and green gel was added to it which to me was super weird, but my husband thought it was "cute". So it all worked out.

Thanks! The 47-year-old birthday boy is happy.
author: Camille L.

description: Stopped in SF to visit a friend and this place was in her neighborhood.  I picked up the baked roast pork buns, the gai mai bao (the peanut and coconut long buns) and a few egg tarts to take home.  The gai mai bao was really good, the baked roast pork was meh and the egg tarts were good.  When I am back for another visit, it'll be the gai mai bao and egg tarts to go.
author: Susan C.

description:
My boyfriend and I needed a cake for our graduation celebration. 

It was last minute so we were relieved that they offered a quality cake for a reasonable price that fed about 60 - 80 people.

They had a variety of flavors to choose from such as, strawberry, mixed fruit, mocha or chocolate.

We decided to order a full sheet (17x25) Strawberry cake. The spongy cake was so fluffy and the strawberries added a refreshing taste after every bite. All of my guests loved it!

I rate this bakery 5/5 STARS! I would highly recommend ordering a cake here for your next celebration :D
author: Wednesday D.

description: I love this bakery. I moved to Davis from San Francisco shortly before the change in ownership and was a little worried but I've heard that everything is still just as good. I tried their pineapple buns recently and still so soooo good. Whew!!! I don't visit San Francisco much these days but I always make a visit to Sunset Bakery every time I do!!
author: Grace O.

description:
Their Chinese pastries and breads are one of the best in the city. I always get strawberry shortcake slices because they not only taste good, but they look like they're straight from an anime (heehee). I love their cakes because it's the asian type, not too sweet but sweet enough. I appreciate how they use whip cream instead of frosting. Their sponge cake is like the fluffiest and bounciest pillow ever. My boyfriend's mom loved their cake for her birthday. We ordered a small 8" inch strawberry cake
For her birthday. It came up to $23 no tax. You gotta be quick because they sell out and they don't make anymore for the rest of the day. You can also get free cake engravings on it as well. :) 

Only sucky thing is that they only take CASH.
author: Casey Y.

description: Came here last minute to get a cake for my gfs bday. Cake was pretty good considering we came right when they were closing.
author: Shanzay H.

description: This USE to be a great place to buy cake, however since the owner changed (again) this place keeps going downhill. We bought a chestnut cake today, and it was 80% cream, 15% cake, 5% chestnut. I'm sorry, did I just spend money to buy cream? I could've went to Safeway and bought a can of whipped cream for less. Hell, even Safeway cake taste way better than this. The stars this place have is a joke.
author: E D.

description:
Don't buy a cake here!  It's spoiled and old.  It will spoil your event and party because who the hell can make sure a cake is fresh unless they are amount to it eat.  Our birthday party was ruined and my kids were so disappointed.  

You make mom and pop shops look bad!
author: Chris L.

description:
I have been going to sunset bakery for many years and they never fail to disappoint. I ordered a strawberry rectangle cake on the same day. She said it feeds 15-20 people. They are CASH ONLY. Which is completely understandable. They had it ready for me 2 hrs after i called. Since it was the end of the day, the lady gave us free 3 free baos. So kind! I never get a Chinese cake anywhere else. Sheng Lee can't compete. Sunset bakery has the best cakes ever!

Total: $41
author: Marisa F.

description: Quite yummy! Probably a little overpriced but a nice treat for sure.  Not a wide selection daily but if you want something specific, give them a little heads up and they'll help you out. Be patient when talking to them as they're quite old but seem pretty nice.  NOTE: CASH ONLY!!
author: Cole E.

description: We bought a Strawberry Shortcake for my grandsons birthday.  If was beautiful and delicious.  I highly recommend it
author: Cathy S.

description: We ordered a three tiered strawberry cake for our wedding as well as some dim sum deserts. The cake and deserts were delivered on time and were delicious!  The cake and deserts were also very affordable compared to other places we looked at. You can chose from a series of cake decorating styles. We also had our florist add some flowers to create the look we wanted.
author: Lana R.

description:
Wow.... my family ordered the strawberry sponge cake and BBQ pork buns for Chinese New Year celebration this weekend and I was surprised on  how great the pork buns were!  The filling was not artificial tasting like some places .  The cake was fresh with tasty strawberries  .  I will
Drive up to SF just for their goodies .
author: Sandra L.

description:
amazing caked with super reasonable prices. they have a variety of cakes in different sizes and they are all yummy, fresh and light.
they also have a lot of pastries and the ones I tried were made well.
cash only!
author: Helia S.

description:
Maybe the good reviews are for the items they sold out of that we couldn't try. But 2/3 things we ordered came out pretty disgusting.

We were walking around Golden Gate Park all day, starving, and craving sweets when we walked by this little bakery. Our favorite Asian bakeries nearby were closed, so we strolled in. 

The entire bakery smelled like cigarettes but no one was smoking outside the entrance. It had to be coming from the back kitchen. No bueno. What if I was pregnant? Food babies don't count, I know, but come on. Not to mention it's highly unappetizing as a bakery should smell like freshly baked goods. STRIKE 1.

Nothing really stood out and they were sold out of egg custards and a few other things we wanted. Well we were inside and the lady looked eager to take our order, so we bought 3 mini cakes with yellow and red colored jelly on top (the kind Chinese bakeries often use to write on birthday cakes), 4 pineapple buns with red bean inside, and an eclair. 

The lady charged us a little bit more than what we totaled up, but oh well. Against the principle, but oh well. Not going to argue over that. Still though - STRIKE 2.

They take cash only. We paid and she handed us our goodie box and as we left, realized she didn't hand us the other half. I ran back in and asked for it, and she hurriedly retrieved it and told us NEXT time we come, she'll give us extra. STRIKE 3 

Let me tell you why we're never coming back...

First off, the mini cakes tasted nothing like we expected. Colored jelly/frosting is always artificial but should be very tasty, right? Not here. The jelly had gone bad or they used too much chemical coloring and no other flavoring. The red jelly had zero flavor. Bland, fine. That sucks, but not as much as the yellow one sucked. It had a bitter, plastic-like aftertaste that was bad enough that I spat it out immediately. It's probably that same infamous yellow 5 in Mountain Dew that kills your sperm. Or something worse that kills your liver. DO NOT ORDER ANY CAKE WITH JELLY IN IT. STRIKE 4.

The cake inside and white cream on top was very plain and lacked that light fluffiness you expect from Chinese cakes. No flavor, too. Perhaps if that had more flavor it would mask the nasty jelly flavor, but nope. 

The eclair had a very weird after taste, and I'll tell you how bad it was now.

1. As soon as we picked it up the chocolate on top completely flaked off. Weird. 
2. The cream inside had an odd aftertaste, like they used a bunch of fillers. The main ingredient in custard is egg yolk. That's what makes it rich, creamy, and yellow. 
3. That weird bitterness we tasted in that yellow jelly returned. DAMN IT STOP USING THAT NASTY YELLOW #5. 
4. The baked outer portion tasted like it sat in a fridge for days. Safeway eclairs taste 10x better... STRIKE 5.

As for the 4 red bean pineapple buns, they were pretty standard, didn't taste old or stale like the other items but could have had a lot more sweet crumbles on top, and more red bean inside. 3/5.

Overall 2/5 not coming back.
author: Ivy C.

description: If you're going to purchase a cake at Sunset Bakery, DO NOT purchase their pre-made from their refrigerator.... they are NOT made fresh daily!!!  It's now the second time we've purchased the strawberry sponge cake and it's BAD!!!  The strawberries were brown and the rotten strawberries fermented the cake.  I'm wondering how long it sat in the refrigerator as there's no date labeled. This is the only bakery where you'll experience the aroma of stinky cake!  It's really embarrassing for me because it was purchased for a birthday celebration.... no cake after the birthday dinner and total let-down!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Li H.

description:
In having just eaten lunch in the area I was craving something sweet to top of my meal. I knew that there were quite a few options in the area but I came here solely because it was on the way back to my car. 

In looking through the window from the street this place is a bit small. When you walk inside you first encounter the few tables, fridges to the right, and the pastry case directly in front of you.

The selection that I saw when I walked in was somewhat unique to some of the other Chinese bakeries that I have been to. The walnut cake was something that I haven't seen in other bakeries. The cheesecake looked really good as well, it is in slices. The fridge is comprised of juices and sodas. 

The best part about this place would have to be the prices. Most of the individual items range from $0.80 to roughly $1.20 or so depending on the item. Either way that is a pretty sweet deal.

I went with a basic option because I need to get going so I bought some chocolate chip cookies. They cookies were OK. The cookies were a bit hard but not stale. I was looking for that gratifying taste that I typically get when biting into a chocolate chip cookie but this place missed the mark. Not sure how long the cookies had been out or how fresh they were but the toughness to the cookies was a bit of a challenge for me.

I would could back to sample some of their cakes. I'm not sure if the make specialized cakes or not but based on what I saw when I was there I would think so!

Maybe today was just a bad timing issue so I'll give this place another shot. 

#onetoughcookie
author: Robert F.

description: This place looks a little suspect from the outside but has some of the delicious Chinese pastries. Their bbq pork bun is my favorite along with the cocktail bun, curry beef, and red bean. The chicken one is like a pot pie filling which is interesting. I've never had any of their European style pastries though.
author: Young L.

description:
CAKE REVIEW ONLY!
Overall 3.5 for the chestnut cake.

Super friendly mom and pop shop, cash only.
$31.50 for a 9" cake, super reasonable.

Asian-style fluffy cake with filling, no frills! Cake could be a bit more moist and filling could be sweet - perfect if you're looking for a cake that's not overfly sweet. Would satisfy older folks' taste palettes (if you're looking to reserve a cake for a wedding or big event!)

I will say that the cream on the outside isn't thick or oily, and just the right amount of sweetness. I usually scrape the cream away from the cakes but since this cake was more mild in flavor and was JUST on the borderline of not being moist enough for me, it was perfect with the cake.

Looks like I should return for the pineapple buns and other baked goods!
Owner and workers here are extremely friendly and helpful :)
author: Emily C.

description:
We came to this bakery on a search for a chestnut cake.  Though they were sold out, they offered to start making one that I could pick up later in the day.  I found this to be incredibly kind - especially considering that unless you order ahead, many bakeries do not offer this on short notice.  I declined and wound up getting a mixed fruit cake instead along with some egg tarts and a chicken pie.  All of that totaled $25 and I was very surprised at how inexpensive it was.

After returning home, we dug into the cake and found it was deliciously moist and fluffy.  Sweetness level was perfect - almost delicate - and the featured fruits were fresh.  

Great quality baked goods for a great price!  An easy 5-star rating.

Note: cash only.
author: Sheila C.

description: Favorite cake hands down. We usually get their white cake with strawberry. The cake itself is super light and fluffy. The whip cream is also light and not too sweet. My go-to all the time favorite!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
We came to this place to satisfy our strawberry cake craving, and there were so many reviews about Sunset Bakery's strawberry cake on Yelp! We decided to give it a try and we were not disappointed. The cake was spongy, delicious, and not too sweet. We decided to get more after finishing the cake in 30 seconds. The cream puff had good texture, and the soymilk was tad sweet and refreshing. All this was for $6 only! Would recommend coming here :)

Tip: Cash only! Also, the bathroom is in the back of the kitchen and not so clean.
author: Pitch M.

description:
Got a BBQ pork bun, a pineapple BBQ bun, a fruit tart and a mango juice all for $5

Legit can't beat that. Been craving some authentic Asian baked goods and finally it has happened!!!! Cheap and delicious. Totally recommend getting the tart, not too sweet :)

Julie was really sweet. Came back to buy some more and she gave us a sample coconut bun to try. Woohoo!
author: Jacqui L.

description: I got my birthday cake here (a mixed fruit cake) and it was very tasty. The cream and frosting on the cake was light and not too sweet. The variety of fruits in the cake was fresh. I will definitely order cakes from here from now on! :)
author: Maria V.

description:
This morning I dropped by to have a sponge cake as I always did every morning. I felt excited and was really looking forward to this. So I purchased my sponge cake and a 

I took two bites into the cake and realized that it was moldy. I reached out to the shop owners to let them know, but they were not helpful in addressing my concerns, and denied that their food was moldy. I have called the SF Health Agency about this matter.

I would be weary of eating at this place again as their food may be a health hazard.
author: Linda C.

description:
Very friendly service.

We only had the pineapple buns, which are an affordable 80 cents apiece. I'm not a pineapple bun fan, but the SO approved. There is some indoor seating available but the space is small.

Located within walking distance to Santung so if you've got a bit of a wait on that long list, maybe take a quick walk out to this bakery! Dessert before dinner makes the waiting time shorter ;)
author: Sue V.

description:
Pineapple buns, coconut bun, BBQ pork bun, egg tarts, strawberry sponge cake, you name the Asian pastry and they most likely have it! All at a ridiculous low price and unbelievably delicious! My go to spot in the city for baked goods!

Located in an area of limited parking between Kirkham and Judah on 9th, you most likely will have to park far and walk or pull an illegal parking job to reach the bakery. Or take the muni. They have a stop right out front. But trust me, it's worth it. 

The shop is pretty small. So if you come during a busy rush hour, it's going to feel cramped. But order away at the counter. Best sellers are definitely the Pineapple buns which sell out quick at 80 cents a piece. Super flakey and soft and buttery. I can see why it sells quick. And also BBQ Pork Buns at approx 1.20 a piece. Affordable with a good amount of sweet BBQ pork and just the amount of soft bread wrapped around it. Unlike most places that mostly wrap the non-existent meat with bread. I have to say probably the most delicious pork buns out there! And I have had my share. I tried their curry meat bun, coconut bun, and egg tarts as well and they are all so delicious. Even stored for days later and still good. 

They also are constantly busy for their strawberry sponge cake. I have to say I haven't bought a sheet of it yet for a party (planning on it), but usually just buy slices to go (less than $3!). The cream is light and not overly sweet and compliments the soft sponge perfectly. The fresh strawberries adds to the perfect amount of sweet you want in a cake. Don't go expecting Kara or Sprinkles level sweet, just light enough to hit and satisfy your sweet tooth. I asked the ladies behind the counter how long it usually takes to call in an order. They said call the same day and we can have it ready! Now isn't that something! 

Not looking for an Asian treat, no worries. They also sell plain muffins, cupcakes, and cookies as well! I haven't tried, but the prices are definitely appealing. 

Service is amazing. When they're slow (come early morning to get your goods), they start small talk and get to know their customers. Sweet! And when they're busy, they are fast and efficient and still manage to be patient and nice! 

Oh and before I forget... cash only - as expected like most places in the city.
author: Joan T.

description:
I always pass this bakery every day, but I never have any temptations to try it until one day my friend came to my other friend's house where we had a study group and he brought 5 BBQ Pork buns from this bakery.
I looked at it and decided to eat it half and half with my other friend.
After I tried the other half, I took my other half from my friend because I LOVE it so much!
The bun was so moist and tasty!
I will definitely drop by to buy more buns sometimes soon!
author: Candice L.

description:
Oh maaan. Our lovely neighbors decided to bring us back a box of pork buns. Char siu bao. I can only imagine how these things taste fresh out the oven. The sweet bun is soft but hard enough to hold the generous amount of pork inside. 12 of them. 12 I have to eat.

I find it wierd that a bakery that sells cakes and other desserts also specialize in meat buns. Im gonna have to take a trip out to the sunset and brave the traffic on 19th.

Sometimes, I hate that good food is so easy to get in SF.
author: Kris P.

description:
If you're Asian and have lived in the Sunset for any long stretch of time then you've most likely eaten their cakes at some point. They specialize in cakes for weddings, birthdays and special events. Their cakes aren't like the rich, overly sweet, and heavy American style cakes you'd find at your local supermarket. Asian cakes tend to be lighter and filled with fruit. Their staples are mixed fruit and strawberry cakes...at least from my last stop. 

Their prices are reasonable but they take cash only...which likely helps keep costs down. They sell cakes in various rounds and sheet sizes and even at 4pm they still had enough of selection to match the party size I was expecting. They will personalize the cake for you for free and they did it quickly for me. 

Overall, service was quick and attentive, the prices are really reasonable, and the cakes are always on point and moist with just enough sweetness. The store can perhaps offer more selection in their showcase like you'd find at Shubert's and look a bit more cleaned up but most people take their goods to go. Or maybe I just needed to go earlier in the day for their pastry selection!
author: Sam L.

description: I ordered a simple 12in single tier strawberry cake for my wedding. The cake was so delicious! Not too sweet and very light. The ordering process was easy for us. We just called it in over the phone and scheduled a date and time to pick the cake up. They are a cash only business so just keep that in mind when ordering. A nice hidden gem, thank you Sunset Bakery!!!
author: Summer L.

description:
Best pineapple buns in the city. If you're going to eat them right away (which seems to happen to me quite often...) ask if they have a hot one coming or on a cooling rack. The buns sell well though and even the ones in the case are by no means old.

I miss getting them in Hong Kong for less than $0.25.  (cheap, abundant pineapple buns everywhere, it was paradise) This is where I go when I want to capture that feeling again.
author: Mike N.

description:
ATTENTION!
Under new ownership, old reviews are no longer valid.

I knew something was amiss. I noticed a drastic change in taste, texture, and quality. Filled buns were once delicious, hearty and delightful, now they are literally hollow shells of the legacy that was Sunset Bakery. Cakes are not moist and fluffy as before and just don't taste fresh and light anymore. 

Filled buns appear to be plump with goodness but instead are mostly air inside with little of the goodness they've always had.
The current product is an insult to the history of this fine establishment.
author: William S.

description:
UPDATE: The pork buns are much better then they were months ago. Looks like the new owners have stepped it up, a bit. The flavor is still good. The ratio of pork to bun has improved. But, a little more fat than the original owner's product.

I would buy again. It's not my go-to place, though.
author: Debbie T.

description: Very friendly staff and fresh bakery items!  This place was on our way from the 16th Ave Tiled Steps back up to the Golden Gate Park and I was happy to find this place because we were hungry.  They have a big variety of pastries that are freshly made and you can see the employees rolling out the dough in the back.  We got a BBQ Pork Bun and a Ham and Egg Bun and they hit the spot while we were on our trek to our next destination.  Looking forward to returning on our next trip!
author: Loretta C.

description:
Went to buy a chestnut cake because I am a big fan of chestnut cake. A small one around 5 inch to 6 inch. It was $6.50 if I did not remember wrong. 

Cake itself was dry, the chestnut itself was okay. I was expecting it could be smashed chestnut but it was diced chestnut mixed with cream. When you cut the cake, I found out they gave too less cream between the cakes which makes the whole cake dryer. Even they had good whipped cream on top, it ended up feeling so dry. I gotta admit I have my ideal chestnut cake and I probably using it to compare with the chestnut cake in sunset bakery. But it was just okay. I ended up bought another cake in wholefood and it has more moist in the cake than this chestnut cake in sunset bakery. well enough said.
author: Stephanie H.

description: A co-worker ordered their delicious fruit and whipped cream half sheet cake for a holiday event. I stopped in when I was in the area to buy a slice, and bought the strawberry version. The sponge cake is quite light and the icing not overly sweet. I suggest you visit for your next occasion, or to treat yourself. They sell a variety of other pastries, Asian and Western. Service was pleasant. The lady confirmed the owners are different, but the products are the same.
author: Carol W.

description: Just got off the phone with Sunset Bakery about my wedding cake and they went out of their way to be rude and unhelpful. I started speaking in Mandarin (having found this is usually appreciated by Chinese businesses) and the lady interrupted and snapped, "what do you say?" in a heavy Chinese accent lol. I switched to English but the service did not improve. When I asked if they deliver on Sundays, I could feel her rolling her eyes as she replied "yes of course, why would we not." She seemed so annoyed on the call and refused to give me a starting price on a three-tier cakes and said I had to show up in person for this basic information. Lady, I'm based in LA and some minimal consideration would be nice. You also have Chinese characters on your cake boxes but give me shit for speaking Chinese? There's a nicer way to say I prefer speaking English. Why do people shoot themselves in the foot by being so rude like this? I'm giving my business to a bakery that can be polite to customers.
author: Joanne Y.

description: Came here because mazzetti's bakery in Pacifica's atmosphere was not very welcoming. When I came here, the employees were so kind and gave me all their attention and really listened to what I wanted and were very patient as I wanted a simple cake but wanted the right one. They accommodated to my needs in size and price and even gave my daughter a free dessert. Cake was just 1 tier with buttercream frosting and strawberries/bananas with whip cream, and even though it was plain which I had to decorate to my liking. The atmosphere took on a 5 star for me.
author: Jen J.

description: Thank you guys for my baby shower cake...and also my other cakes throughout my life! I've loved this bakery for decades now and people always ask where my cake is from. They are a must for me for every occasion.
author: Angeline B.

description:
Had a wedding cake made by them. Agreed on the price delivered to the venue..left a deposit. 

Came back a week before the wedding (as they requested) and   some extra fees were added on. A $500+ dollar cake turned to a $700 cake. Since it was 1 week before my wedding, there was nothing I could do..but pay the $700. 

Had to add extra for fruits (which was included in price during the deposit). They charged an additional $25 per tier (had a 5 tier cake).

During the cake cutting ceremony at my wedding, there was no fruits to be found. 

Went back 3 days after my wedding to talk to them. All they said was..."that's impossible, there was fruits inside".

I don't understand how they can tell me there was fruits inside when I was the one to cut it open to find nothing.

Didn't try to apologize, didn't offer anything. Told me to be on my way.

1 star for the cake being there on time
1 star for the exterior of the cake (which looked nice)


Cliff notes:
- Expect additional charges 
- don't bother paying extra for fruit of choice...you won't get it anyways
author: Wilson H.

description:
I wanted a soft, Chinese-styled birthday cake and I got it! My boyfriend ordered the mixed fruit cake, and it was delicious. Fluffy, light, and not too sweet - just the way I like it! The only detail I was not as impressed with was that the fruits did not seem fresh. I'm guessing some of it was canned :( However, at this price point, I'm not complaining.

There are occasions that call for a light cake like the ones Sunset offers and times when heavier American cakes make sense. When I want that airy, light cake that doesn't make you feel too guilty eating 2 slices of, I'll definitely come back to Sunset.
author: Claudia C.

description: I was pleasantly surprised at how my cake looked and tasted for my wedding!! I gave Sunset a pciture of the cake I wanted and they were able to make something very elegant and similar!! There were some mistakes but overall I was totally happy with my cake!! Delivery was on time and the cake lasted all night.  Most important everyone loved how light it was and good it tasted, unlike the heavy/sweet fondant cakes from American bakeries.. Thank you Sunset!! Also their prices are super reasonable, which helped a lot with our wedding budget :)
author: Michelle M.

description:
This is probably the best bakery in sf better than sheng kee ( pineapple bbq bun and coctail bun are to die for) 

This is an updated review for this bakery. After coming to this bakery a couple of times i have decided to update my review.  I still firmly believe that the Cha siu bao are the best in the city. The pineapple bun with just the perfect amount of flakiness will leave you smiling and wishing you have bought more. Also don't forget the cakes, strawberry cake which is my personal favorite is moist and delicious not to sweet. The strawberries are actually sweet and not sour like some bakeries. Everything here is cheap and would probably be more if you went to a fancier bakery. If you are feeling seafood , try their tuna rolls. Don't like tuna but like corn? Try their ham and corn bun.
author: Winston C.

description:
I recently ordered my wedding cake from them as well. One word to describe it - GORGEOUS! 

I got the 4-tier buttercream cake with the highly popular (and current) princess cut design. I wouldn't have it any other way! Moreover, as a person who likes her options, I didn't even go cake tasting because I know Sunset Bakery's excellent craftsmanship.
author: Mabel Y.

description: DON'T GET THE STRAWBERRY CAKE! The strawberries were moldy and the cake and cream was sour. It was disgusting and I spent $30 on it for no one to eat it. Once we cut the cake, it already smelled bad. How could they sell me a cake that is maybe a week old. My cousin threw up from it so if you don't want to get food poisoning don't go here to get cake.
author: Jazlynn G.

description: I bought some individual cakes to go and they were very hard. The hardest I've ever eaten. It was cheap though so I don't mind it too much. You get what you pay for
author: Nona K.

description: I was looking for a strawberry cake for my sister's 40th birthday.  Tried a slice to test it.  It was similar to many Asian bakeries ... the cake was dry and the cream tasted like it came out of a can and had a slightly fake taste to it.  The cake was very inexpensive ... maybe $22?  I think sometimes you get what you pay for, and for $22, the cake is going to be cheaper.  I ended up going to a slightly more expensive european bakery and their strawberry cake was moist and delicious.  I was sad that I didn't like Sunset Bakery more.  I was hoping to like this bakery because I like to support my local businesses.  Sorry.
author: Christina ?.

description: Good variety of baked items. Tried the Mexican bun, pineapple bun, sponge cake (which had a tad too much flavor of egg in it) and red bean moon cake. Prices are very reasonable.
author: P B.

description:
Quite possibly the best birthday cake. Ever.

If you love fluffy white cake with fruit on top, Sunset Bakery is your place. Whether it's for an intimate occasion or large celebration, they've got you covered. And for a good price.

Call ahead if you want a big order, their large sheet cake can feed up to 75 people pretty easily, but you need to give them notice. For something like this, you'll pay $100. Cash only.

Smaller cakes can be purchased same day and you can have it personalized. It won't be super fancy or anything, but no one cares what the words look like once they bite into this cake extravaganza.

Just get one, even if it's not your birthday. No one has to know.
author: Abby S.

description: My family has been buying birthday cakes from here for almost 20 years it seems. Sunset bakery is known for its perfect execution of the birthday cake. With a fluffy frosting that isn't too sweet and its light, spongy layers of cake, you just can't go wrong. They have mocha flavored cakes, vanilla cakes w strawberries, and vanilla cakes w mixed fruit. I usually opt for the strawberry. I'm generally not huge on sweets  (and I don't really like frosting....) but I can definitely devour a good two pieces in one go. I'd highly recommend their cakes for those that want something simple and not too overwhelming.
author: Marny N.

description:
When comparing Chinatown to the Sunset and Richmond neighborhoods, the commonalities stop at the high density of Asian people. The Asian suburbia has better Asian restaurants, better milk tea, and, of course, more space and cleanliness. Unfortunately, this Asian suburbia also has more fog and more expensive grocery stores, dimsum, and baked goods. Opportunity costs, opportunity costs.

Sunset Bakery is a small modest bakery that stocks affordable Asian pastries. They don't tout the same fluffy-wuffy theme that the bakery branches like Sheng Kee and Kee Wah boast, which makes them more like a Chinatown bakery transplant.

I snagged a $0.70 PINEAPPLE BUN (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sunset-bakery-san-francisco?select=WqVain3uFFK-oPTdOGn9Xw#A08BmoAfvxnvaW_2gi6Xvg), which did its duty in curbing my hunger. The sugary crust top is a bit drier than those I've tried in Chinatown--perhaps they use less lard, making it less oily. Or perhaps they bake it longer, since the bread dough is soft and chewy but isn't as pliant as others I've had. Not bad, but I would prefer a pineapple bun from Chinatown.

I give them 3.5 stars, but I would have to try more of their items to round up to 4.

Side note: they have full custard pies and apple pies for $7. Now THAT is cheap.
author: Adele F.

description: Great for traditional style Chinese cakes. These are the cakes I grew up eating at family birthday parties. Cakes are light and fluffy. When I went, the flavors they had were: mocha, mixed fruit, and strawberry. I grabbed the smallest round cake for $21. The fruits are fresh and the cakes do not harden even after days in my fridge.
author: Vicki L.

description: Sunset Bakery makes the best cakes for any occasion: birthdays, Mother's Day, holidays, and weddings. Their cakes are light and fluffy. Imagine eating a pillow! I usually get the mixed fruit cake. Though I have tried the strawberry cake based on other reviewers' tips, I highly HIGHLY recommend getting the mixed fruit cake. The 8" cake that serves 6-8 people costs $19 now, so please have cash ready. On a side note, their baked pork buns are absolutely delicious. My pop loves them, so that makes them legit!
author: Joanne K.

description:
If you're looking for a traditional Chinese spongey fruit cake, this is your place! 

Chinese cakes are legit here. My favorite is the crushed roasted CHESTNUT Chinese fruit cake.
author: Ellen W.

description:
Strawberry cake! Strawberry pie!
This is the family go to bakery for chinese American pasteries. Only drawback is the lack of parking in the area..
author: M F.

description:
Wow, definitely glad I gave this bakery a try! I was looking for a standard bakery for morning pastries, and this seemed not quite that. They do, in fact, have some standard pastries, but the stars are the Chinese pastries. Plus, the prices are unbeatable!

I came in this morning after a run and grabbed a pineapple bun, lemon poppyseed muffin, mini pork bun, and an egg custard. The total price? Less than $5. Seriously.

The pineapple bun was good but didn't quite taste like pineapple. It had a nice sweet dough and was very soft (they gave me a fresh one out of the oven). The lemon poppyseed was pretty standard--nothing to write home about but also not bad. Pork bun was delicious. Sweet dough with a BBQ pork inside. And the mini size wasn't all that mini either. The egg custard was also a winner. Not too sweet, but the consistency of the crust and the custard were spot on. 

Looking forward to going back next time I'm in the inner sunset!
author: Julia N.

description: Man this is the best place for some good quick budget buns and sweets. I go to school and never have time to pack a lunch so i always hit up the bakery and get a corn ham bun or bbq pork or green onion bun for lunch. Sometimes these god dam buns smell so good i have to eat one on the road before.i make it to the school. They are always made fresh and dam good for only 1.20. Seriously 2 of these buns fill me up  on a budget and my classmates be like where this place at? Only big concern is the lack of parking so i have to do a guilty double park in front of a house to usually get the goods.. But im usually in and out in 5 mins so no harm done. The little old lady there is always nice and supet friendly too.
author: Jordan S.

description:
What girl or guy doesn't like a pair of nice hot buns?  Oh..yes..I'm totally talking about the pineapple buns here!  What did you think I was referring to?  At 70 cents a piece they are way cheaper than Sheng Kee's.  I was in the area for an appointment and decided to get one to save for breakfast the next day.  It was served to me nice and hot, but was still just as moist and wonderful the next day.  They are a little more crummy (but bigger too) than SK's.  

I was also tempted to get some more goodies for the road but refrained.  Cash only but cheap and great.  I"ll definitely come back when in the area for more pineapple buns!
author: Cat C.

description:
Best fresh strawberry cake! Spongey-moist cake & sweet (but not too sweet) creamy icing. 
I bought a large sheet for my son's baptism back in 1998! 

Over the years, I haven't been here since I moved to the East Bay. But, I will soon be back! Oh, yes-- I will be back!
author: Sheila S.

description: My expectations for this place have changed. I had ordered a 5 tier cake from this place for my wedding and they lost our paper that we paid a deposit and found it later on and rewrote the whole paper and charged us more for the cake and even  for fruits we wanted to add to the cake cost extra money when this was not told to us before. Our wedding cake , didn't even have any fruits. So sad to say I won't be coming back to this place anymore . It seems like things got worse after they had changed owners..
author: Melanie N.

description:
Their egg tart is very satisfying, especially at the amazing price of $0.70 each. It's perfectly flaky, and the custard is not too sweet. Just the way like it! I think AA bakery in Chinatown is better, but this is a close second. 

I came here once at around 4:00pm to buy some egg tarts, but they ran out, so come early. The lady recommended the egg custard slice instead, but it was a total let down. Don't get it.

They also have amazing pineapple bun. It has no pineapple ingredients. It just has a criss cross pineapple design.
author: Nari C.

description:
My husband and I were looking for a fairly priced wedding cake for our Chinese reception. We stumbled upon this place and decided to order since they had the exact cake that we wanted at an affordable price. We ordered a three tier cake and picked it up.
The cake itself was very light and fluffy, just what we wanted. I liked how the cream wasn't too heavy and didn't leave me feeling sick afterwards. My only feedback is that the cake could've used an additional layer of fruit.
I was also very very scared of the delivery method, as they suggested I bring the cake myself to the venue. They told us to just put it in our trunk and drive slowly and that 'everyone' does it. We listened to them and were relieved that our cake didn't topple in the car...PHEW!
author: Kristen T.

description: I called to order the famous strawberry birthday cake for pickup, but the morning of the day I was supposed to pick it up, the birthday girl had to cancel and reschedule to next week. They were very gracious to let me reschedule my pickup to the following Thursday, and when I picked up the cake the woman behind the desk was very kind and welcoming. The cake was absolutely delicious and I'm going to order another one for a birthday for next week!!
author: Lora L.

description: Delicious tasty cakes! I ordered a mixed fruit cake from here for my son's 100 days party and my bf's dad birthday. Everyone loved it, especially the elders cause it's not too sweet and rich. The cake is very light, moist, fluffy and creamy but the food presentation need improvement. The cursive was messy and the fruits were dried out.
author: Joyce C.

description: I have coming here as long as ArtsCafe and have had no complaints until now. The one star is for the Pork buns only. Either they changed bakers or recipe or they are cheaping  out on the filling. But it is now dryer and hardly any meat filling. Owners, please fix this issue!
author: H L.

description: Sunset Bakery made our wedding cake. We got the strawberry cake and it was delicious! They delivered it on time and it was beautiful. I ordered it plain and had my florist decorate it with fresh cut flowers. Everything went perfectly. They also had good customer service. Overall a good experience.
author: Natalie K.

description: Light, fluffy cakes! Been coming here for the mixed fruit cake my entire life and it's consistently good. The cream is more like a fresh whipped cream instead of the sugary icing that you'd find on your average cake. Like eating a cloud.
author: Juliane S.

description: This is the best place to get Chinese cake in my opinion.  I'm not usually a fan of sweets, but I can never resist or turn down an opportunity to gorge on Chinese cake from Sunset Bakery.  Light fluffy, not too sweet cake topped with slightly sweet creamy frosting loaded with strawberries (or other fruits if strawberries aren't in season).  Plus, you can't beat the price of $20 for an 8" round!
author: Christina L.

description:
My family and I have been ordering light and moist chocolate cakes from this nothing-but-awesome bakery for two decades.

A true gem.
author: Jade C.

description: Their strawberry cake is still the best and the taste hasn't changed from when I ordered it for my wedding 8 years ago. I read that they are selling the bakery so better come in and get their cakes while you still can. Sad.
author: Al T.

description:
We got our wedding cake from Sunset Bakery. We ordered a 3-tier strawberry cake for about 120 guests. We are so happy with our decision to use them, and we'd do it again in a heartbeat. Not only was this cake delicious, it was a good value and the service was on point. 

==4.5 stars: Taste==
Our guests loved the cake and said it was the "lightest cake" they've ever had. Absolutely delicious and not too sweet.

==3.5 stars: Design==
The bakery has a few different options for flavors and design. They will add a ribbon if one is provided. We opted for a simple design and had our florist add fresh flowers. This is not the place to go for any avant-garde designs, but we weren't looking for that so it was perfect for us.

==4.5 stars: Service==
It was easy to order the cake. We paid in full on the day we ordered it. In addition, the bakery was very accommodating when we had to change our delivery time by 30 minutes. In addition, when they delivered, they were extremely efficient and on time.
author: K K.

description: I drove all the way from Monterey to have this delicious cocktail bun it's more of a childhood dessert that I grew up eating but it is delicious and so worth 111 mile drive!!
author: Danielle M.

description: Review for the "new" Sunset Bakery. It has new owners. Some of the same employees are still there, unfortunately they've changed the menu, recipe, or cooking methods a lot - it isn't the same bakery at all anymore. They used to make on of the best chung yow bao (Green Onion Bun)in SF, no longer. They only make mok bao (wheat raisin bun) for special orders now. The bolo bao (Pineapple Bun) is sweeter than before, way too sweet now. The Hong Kong Style Milk Tea used to be tops, now it's just okay. Sad, that was a weekly stop for us...
author: James P.

description:
Lady at the store had an attitude. Got home and unpacked the cake and it HAD MOLD ON IT! How long are they leaving their pastries out to allow mold to grow? Nasty! 

Avoid this place if possible...
author: Saurabh R.

description: The cream has changed and they now use "nondairy ready to whip cream". It tastes fake. Also the sponge cake quality has changed and is much drier now. Turns out ownership has changed. The original owner has retired. I've been coming to this place since 1986 and we always get our cakes here. Sorely disappointed that my go-to bakery is no longer.
author: foodfan k.

description:
Came by for some baked goods the other day.

The highlight of the order was definitely the strawberry shortcake. The cake itself was very fresh and moist. The cake and cream wasn't too sweet and it was rather light.

The egg tart was okay. Although slightly crispy, the ones from Golden Gate bakery are much better.

The BBQ pork bun was okay...
author: Derek S.

description:
Health alert: I got a chocolate roll from here and after my wife and daughter ate it, FOOD POISONING. Based on some earlier reviews, this is possibly true for quite a few items here, and I wish we inspected what we were eating more closely instead of gobbling it down based on other raving reviews. My 5 year old has been vomiting all night, and this is not a review out of frustration - rather it is about cautioning all other parents there. Do not give stuff off the shelf to your kids - especially if you are going there for the first time.

This place is probably ok for old timers only who know what they are getting into, and it should be kept that way.
author: Rishi P.

description: 6 stars. Very friendly and helpful. Was able to get a custom cake in a very short period of time. Really appreciate all the help!
author: Mitch C.

description:
I ordered a strawberry sponge cake for my daughter's 4th birthday and their decorated with a Hello Kitty picture, which was cute. The cake is delicious and inexpensive. So the following year, we ordered the same cake for my daughter's 5th birthday party and it was also a hit. 

Their pineapple buns, pork buns, tuna buns, hot dog buns and egg/ham buns are good. I've eaten almost all the buns. I've frequented this bakery since I was a kid. My mom use to buy us a slice of strawberry or chocolate cake if we got A's in our report card. That was 15 years ago! Needless to say, I love this bakery and now my daughter loves it too.
author: Linda M.

description: Love Love Love this place. I usually only get bbq pork bun, shredded pork bun and the cake. Everything is always fresh and the price is SUPER cheap! It is CASH ONLY. One time I was a dollar off but they still let me get my items. Which was super sweet of them. I always get families birthday cakes from here. They usually have cakes ready in the fridge, but it always better to call and order ahead of time. The staff is very quick and they are super friendly!
author: Chantel H.

description: I called the day of to buy a birthday cake for my mom which everyone reading probably thinks I'm a horrible daughter for only ordering a cake the day of my mom's birthday but in my defense my family stopped doing birthday cakes a long time ago as we rarely finish them but on a whim I thought why not surprise mama with a cake! Anyways I called in and the nice lady on the phone saved me a cake so I can pick it up at closing. I showed up and she confirmed the cake I ordered: white angel cake with strawberries and mama, happy birthday on it. She then gathers 3 pineapple buns and put it in a bag which I thought was odd as no other customers were there and I didn't order them. She puts it on top of the cake box and said she threw them in as they made it fresh and said they're known for them and that it was FREE OF CHARGE! Okay, the AZN in me LOVESSSS free but even if it's free crappy food I would be like thanks but no thanks. And for this bakery to be an Asian run bakery (we all know how stingy we can be) to hand out free buns it was pretty awesome! I had one of the buns driving home and I'm not going to like it was pretty freakin good. It was great advertising for her as now I'm going back for more - her plan all along? Who knows but that kind of customer service is appreciated!
author: Yvonne L.

description:
It's a small bakery without fancy decoration.  I am glad I searched Yelp and checked out reviews before I went.  Egg custards are very tasty, but the spongy cakes are even better!  I also got BBQ pork buns. Kids love them, too.  I was going to get mini pineapple buns, but they only have them in regular size.  I wish they make mini pineapple buns.

We will definitely come back for more next time.  Highly recommended it!
author: Alison C.

description:
I don't normally write a review on yelp, but Sunset Bakery had done a fantastic job on my son's 1st birthday cake which deserve a five stars review! I arrived at Sunset Bakery on a stormy Saturday morning to order a full sheet birthday cake for the party. It was a nautical theme party and I was expecting to pick one of the sugar sheet designs from their collections. Unfortunately, they didn't have anything that match our nautical theme. I was in panic mode as the party was in two weeks. The lady at the front was super nice to comfort me that I still had time and didn't need to rush to pick a design that didn't match our theme. She suggested that I could find a design that I like and their baker can try to draw it on the cake. I came back few days later and gave them a drawing for the cake. The baker confirmed he could do it! I was happy to hear they could draw the design yet a bit skeptical and worried the outcome wouldn't be what I have envision. When I picked up the cake, I was very happy to see the result has exceeded my expectation! It matched our party decoration perfectly and the strawberry filled cake was light and fluffy. All of our guests enjoyed the cake a lot! 

I chose Sunset Bakery because I had also ordered my wedding cake from them five years ago. The cake came out beautiful and I remembered they accommodated our request to deliver the cake earlier for our decoration! It was a 5-tiers sponge cake with fruit filling at reasonable price. I definitely recommend Sunset Bakery to my friends and family!
author: Christina C.

description:
Hate it when you buy a bbq pork bun and the bread feels stale and you have to dig deep only to find a few measly pieces of pork with barely any flavor?

Well let me tell you, Sunset Bakery does it right! Their pork buns are  fresh, dense and filled with flavorful chunks of bbq pork. Be careful it is addictive!
author: Yin L.

description: Made these cute cupcakes for my son's class. Called them in an hour and they had these made ready for me.  Really good service.
author: G M. C.

description: I was giving a lecture at UCSF and was starting crave some Chinese pastries.  I didn't want to deal with the parking hassles around Clement and Geary, so I put out an inquiry on Facebook for suggestions for bakeries in the Inner Sunset area.  Within a few minutes my cousin pointed me to this place.  I was fortunate enough to find parking nearby and walked up to the store, only to discover that I had actually been here before.  As compared to the Chinatown bakeries it's quite small with a limited selection of items, but what they do have is very good.  The pineapple buns (I grew up calling them sweet top buns) were among the best that I've had.  They were huge and the topping actually stayed crisp all day long.  Often, these get a little soggy if you don't eat them right away,  The egg custards were very good, but the crust was not as flaky as I prefer.  On the plus side, it also wasn't as greasy as the flaky crust tends to be.  The baked BBQ pork buns were quite tasty, but the pork itself was perhaps just a little overseasoned.  However, the bread was moist and just the right amount of sweetness.  Overall, we were very pleased with this place and I expect that I'll be stopping by frequently whenever I find myself back at UCSF.
author: Lee L.

description: My favorites here are the chestnut cake and dinner buns. However, the personal size cake is often sold out and when they make another one on the run, they don't out enough chestnut in the layer. However, their cake is good and not too sweet.
author: SJ L.

description: I absolutely LOVE this bakery. The mixed fruit cake is our family favorite. Every since we came across this gem, we have not gone elsewhere. They are the best!! We are not into super sweet artificial and if you aren't either...you will LOVE IT!!!!
author: T. J.

description:
My 196th review! I was hoping to get up to 199 at the end of 2014, but totally forgot.. *le sigh* .. so in place of it, my first review for 2015 will be a good one! 

A new year, means new beginnings. This post is dedicated for my amazing boyfriend! Happy 24th Birthday babe! (New Year's baby ;D) 

First off, let me say asian birthday cakes are the best birthday cakes. The light frosting, minimal design, sponge cake filled with fruits. Everything is so simple, yet so delicious....yum.. 

Sunset Bakery is located right around the corner on 9th Ave & Irving. Parking is hard cause it's Irving. Service was great, as one of the women helped me immediately. A plus about the service is, they speak English too! The place is small, with probably about 10 2-4-seater tables & chairs. CASH ONLY! 

Sunset Bakery offers a good variety of asian pastries such as lemon, cream, and chocolate-filled cakes, pineapple buns, cookies, egg tarts, and much more. This includes asian birthday cakes! They have a lot of birthday cakes already prepared in a fridge next to the front counter - all made, ready to go! You have the option of the strawberry-only cake or mixed-fruit cake. I think for the price of a cake in general (or just Asian cakes I guess...), it's pretty cheap. A small cake serves 8-10 people and is $19. For $2 more ($21), it can serve 10-12 people. If you'd like a bigger cake, I highly suggest calling a week in advance or something. From the pictures, it seems like they also make wedding cakes! 

I bought the large mixed fruit cake ($21) and it was delish! It's filled with bits of melons, kiwi, oranges, strawberries, cream, and other fruits... If this isn't enough info for you, just trust me; it's delicious. The strawberry cake is filled with cream & strawberries. Looking at other reviews, they seem to be a popular one here. Though, I do prefer strawberries, the birthday boy prefers mixed-fruit, haha. If you would like a taste of the strawberry cake before buying a whole cake, the bakery does sell slices of strawberry cakes for about $2 per slice. 

Overall, I would definitely be coming back for more birthday cakes! 
(Hint to the BF: I want an asian strawberry cake for my birthday!! ;D)
My boyfriend loved the cake so much, his mom just told him to buy his own cake this year and he wants to come back here to make the purchase! I guess I made a smart choice ;) 
The price for cakes & pastries is quite reasonable and highly suggest you to come here for a snack or cake! :)
author: Mandy G.

description: Can't go wrong ordering a cake here. Their area wry shortcake is the best and perfect for any occasion. It's whip cream and its just right not too sweet and very affordable
author: DUN UP B.

description:
My wife and I recently ordered our wedding cake from this bakery.

The cake came out beautiful and tasted incredible.  

The prices are really cheap for a wedding cake.  

You will not find better value anywhere..  Not in SF or even the United States for something so good for such a great price.
author: Will C.

description:
food: pineapple bun with a milk tea. the pastries arent warm, but still somewhat fluffy. given i went later in the day. the tea was piping hot at least. ***3/5

service: not really a place to hang out. seems to have a lot of locals ordering cakes. i got what i needed, but it took them a few tries before i got what i wanted. ***3/5

value: a good place for a quick drop in for a drink and snack. a bit expensive compared to chinatown, but you take what you can where you are. ***3/5
author: Andy Z.

description:
Sunset Bakery is a traditional chinese bakery that also sells cupcakes and muffins (must be a neighborhood thang). the typical chinese buns & pastries are present.

tsing tao newspaper too.(.60)

eats: custard tart (.70)
-typical watered down egg custard with fantastic crusts-typical chinatown.
4 stars

crumbs:
-friendly, courteous, efficient service.
-quiet here on an holiday.
author: Victor G.

description:
I arrived one Sunday afternoon and quickly realized that they were selling out of everything. I purchased the remaining egg custard tarts (the reason I was asked to drop by) and added 3 plain pineapple buns (80cents). 
The egg tarts had thicker crust than I remembered, but was flavorful. I loved the pineapple bun the next morning as breakfast. It had a thick even coating of the sweet crust, I wish I had purchased more! 
I was hoping for a slice of the strawberry sponge cake, but that will have to wait until the next time I'm in the area. I'll be buying at least a half dozen of the pineapple buns!
author: Ali C.

description:
Best Bolo Bau (Pineapple Bun) in the Bay Area - period.  Over the past 15+ years, I've tried other Asian bakeries in the city and down in the south bay, some of which have well  known names, but nothing compares to Sunset Bakery's quality, consistency, and price.  The buns were $0.70 for the longest time and just recently increased to $0.80 each - this is still amazing compared to $1.25-$2.00 each some of shops charge in Mountain View and Cupertino.  I make a point to stop by here every time I visit my parents in the city - make sure to come before 3pm because they sell out of this popular item.

My parents always came here for their fruit filled birthday cakes made with light and fluffy layers of yellow cake and real whipped cream.  They also make excellent apple turnovers that have flaky pastry with simple powder sugar icing. This small, family run business has built a solid and loyal customer base and I'm one of them!
author: Bobby C.

description: For our wedding, we wanted a cake that all of our guest would enjoy and still be reasonably priced. My sister in law had used Sunset Bakery for her wedding and everyone really liked it so we decided to go with them also. Placed an order with them 2 months prior to our wedding and gave them the design/supplies I wanted on the cake. On the day of the wedding, they arrived early to set up the cake. It tasted and looked great! We had about 270 guests so we ordered a 5-tier strawberry sponge cake.
author: Rhonda H.

description: this is for the large baked cha sui bow . got 6 the other day what happened ? there was no bbq sause in it ! it was some plain pork put it . horrible I had bought my daughter 6 too ! I texed her about it too ! oh the fruit cake was ok but seemed a little stiff hum prices went up but quality went down ....
author: Nellie J.

description:
Definitely one of my favorite Chinese bakeries in the neighborhood! Lots of cheap, fresh buns, cakes and other baked goods. Great friendly service. Bilingual staff. Most baked goods are around $1 or under. If you don't see something on display, just ask -- what you're looking for may be currently baking or staying warm in the ovens. There's a few chairs and tables inside, but mostly people take their goods to-go.

My favorite item by far is their green onion bun -- always comes to me fresh, warm, and moist. Their version consists of little bits of meat, is in a twisted form, and isn't super oily/greasy like those from other bakeries. Also, their egg tarts are pretty tasty too, with a very flaky crust.
author: Priscilla W.

description: This is the second time we endured 30 minutes of Sunday traffic on 19th avenue to go to Sunset Bakery just to be told they're out of ham and onion bun. The first time was noon and the second was before 11.
author: Cristina G.

description:
I was wondering the streets with my cousins after my grandmother's funeral. We were all wearing suits/black. We felt out of place but just right because it felt like we were apart of the triad.

Anyways, we walked up sunset Bakery after enjoying the foo fu Arizmendi Bakery. My cousin who is from SF recommended the strawberry sponge cake. I was hesistant because I'm not a desserty type person and we already had coffee and other pastries from the other bakery. Needless to say I inhaled the slice after my first bite. My other cousin had no chance to taste it.

Next time I'm here I will buy a whole cake and go to town.
author: Chris L.

description:
Cheap and amazing baked goods, Asian style! :) Definitely reminds me of those bakeries in Hong Kong and the quality here is better than mass-produced Sheng Kee. Would recommend getting the breads here when they are freshly baked (in the morning!), but I guess heating it up in the oven does the trick too. 

For around $5 and some loose change, I was able to buy 4 pineapple buns, 2 sponge cakes, and 1 ham & egg bread. WHAT A STEAL!! :)
author: Michelle L.

description:
Usually come here for their Baked BBQ Pork Bun. It's $1.30 a piece now but so worth it. The BBQ pork filling inside is just amazing. Good size too for a piece of bread. 

Another yummy thing to get here is the pineapple bread/bun. The top of the dough is covered with a sweet crust that just leaves us in awe because I attempted to make it before and it is not easy. Theirs has a great consistency and looks appealing in all ways. $0.70 a piece.

Must try!
author: Benjamin C.

description:
After reading all the positive reviews about this place, I'm confused and disappointed. On a Friday morning, I tried the pork buns and egg tarts. They didn't have any of the raved-about strawberry cake or mixed fruit cake slices. Pork buns:
the pork and sauce were not fresh and the color was almost gray. Totally gross and I am hoping there's no digestive aftermath from eating this. The bread part of the pork bun was fine. Egg tarts: pretty good but not amazing. The crust was flaky and the custard wasn't to sweet, but not memorable. All the other pastries there looked meh and definitely not fresh. Service was also mediocre- the lady wouldn't give me a box and only gave me 2 egg tarts when I ordered 3.
author: carol L.

description:
This is a tiny bakery up on the corner of 9th street in the Sunset.  There isn't much of a selection to view.  However, there are some novelties, such as winter melon cake and Mexican buns.  The winter melon cake has a texture like mochi and a cute story of being made by a man for his wife, which is why it is named after her.  Unfortunately, nothing stands out in terms of flavors including the cream puffs.  

The staff is friendly and service is fast.  Parking can be tough on the street.
author: Jenny L.

description: I travel hours to visit this bakery for their baked pork buns. I haven't tried anything else from there but great customer service and THE BEST pork buns.
author: Shay N.

description:
this is the best place to get pineapple buns!! i'm a big fan of asian pastries  and when it comes to pineapple buns i'm a stickler about the right chewiness on the inside and the texture of the crust on top. THIS PLACE HAS IT DOWN.

when i bite into the pineapple bun, the dough is sooo chewy  and soft. i wonder how they do it, it really must be the yeast they use or something. i'd ask them to give me the recipe, but they'd probably ban me from the place. but seriously, best pineapple buns everrr, the top crust is the perfect crunch, but doesnt taste like it's been sitting out for too long. and of course the pricing is very reasonable here. every time i'm in the area i buy an entire box. i think the only place that comes close to Sunset Bakery are the bakeries in chinatown, but who likes going there...
author: Andy H.

description:
Sunset Bakery makes cakes that remind me of the ones I had growing up in C-town.  A spongecake with whipped cream and fresh fruit (mostly) that's not too sweet, not too heavy.  Only the ones from Sunset are better because the cakes are just a skooch bit eggier.  This is one of my go-to places for birthday cakes. Especially when its for a family celebration and we are in need of a half-sheet or full-sheet.  Plus they've always written whatever bizarre saying my family comes up with on the cake.

They also have great pineapple buns, cocktail buns and various other buns and pastries.  The friend who introduced me to this bakery absolutely loves their individual sponge cakes.  Another friend introduced me to the cakes because her family has been getting their birthday cakes from here for years!

Sunset Bakery would've gotten 5 stars if it weren't for one hiccup.  Once I ordered a custard pie.  Unfortunately, it tasted like a lap cheung custard pie.  Sounds interesting but not the taste we were going for.  

No matter. I'll keep coming back for all the other goodies here.
author: J. P.

description: This is a popular place for Asian Birthday cakes. Nothing too pricey or sweet. Just simple.
author: M C.

description:
I would recommend going with them for birthdays or any other occasion. The popular two flavors are strawberry or fruits - the typical Chinese birthday cake flavors. These sponge cakes are not too sweet and not too fluffy as if full of air. Everyone who have tried the cakes complimented the same. A quarter-sheet was $29.50, and they can add an edible photo overlay or draw a design for $5 more. Cash only, however.

Parking in the area is tough, but there is a bus stop outside. So, you can call your order in, get there and quickly park, then run in for the pick-up. I haven't seen anyone got a ticket for doing that, yet. And, while there are other pastries and sweets and coffees, it's not a place to hang out; almost strictly for grab-and-go or to-go orders.
author: Peter L.

description:
Stopping in for some dessert after lunch at San Tung, I went straight for the Yelp-recommended strawberry cake. And, call me superficial, but I wasn't expecting much when I saw how simple and boring my slice of cake was. But, wow. If you're a fan of the Taiwanese style of cake making, then you'll definitely want to give these guys a try, as they nail the lightness, fluffiness, and tastiness, that you would expect of a legit Taiwanese cake.

And all this goodness for just $1.50! Also, perhaps I lucked out, given the time of day I came in (late afternoon), but I didn't have much trouble finding parking, nor did I find myself facing any sort of crowd while I was here - in fact, my friend and I were the only customers in the bakery the entire time.
author: Johnny W.

description:
I am so happy and so grateful for the nice people here. It was my first time ordering a cake and I had absolutely no idea what to ask. The pleasant woman I spoke with put me at ease and walked me through all the different options:

-sizes and approximately how many people they would serve
-cake types
-decorations (basic ones vs fancy optional extras)
-handling and storage

I picked up the cake a few days later and it was perfect! Perfectly fresh, perfectly light with a hint of sweetness, and the perfect amount for our occasion. I couldn't be more happy.
author: Loli L.

description:
Great cakes! One of the yummiest I have had from a bakery like this!
The prices are very fair!
Cash only I think.....
I am excited to order a custom cake soon! Considering them for our wedding cake! Which reminds me I should go back and buy some more cakes to taste :D
author: Kimia R.

description:
Came to pick up a birthday cake for a friend. It's cash only and I had no cash, so I had to sprint to the Bank of America 1.5 blocks away while hoping my sketchily parked car wouldn't be ticketed. About that: parking is difficult but you can get your goods fast, so sketchy/illegal parking works if you are just going in and and out. Customer service is fast and friendly, and to pick up cakes you just need the phone number and the type of cake.

The cake was $31.50 total. It was a mixed fruit tart cake. and it ended being pretty darn tasty.
author: Michael W.

description:
Best Chinese fruit cakes in the city! They are perfectly light, spongy and plenty of fruits! Their ham&egg buns, cha siew baos and egg custards are definitely a must try here too!

Make sure you ask for the green writing on the cake... it makes the cake taste extra special!
author: Tiffany U.

description:
I've had (on several occasions) their regular egg tarts, their huge egg tart "cake," hot dog buns, green onion bread, bbq pork bun, regular white/sponge cake with fruit filling, and pineapple bun. Needless to say, I've sampled a little bit of everything from them.

Their egg tarts are always delicious and the crust is always done right. I prefer mine a little more toasted, but that's just my own personal taste.

Their hot dog buns, green onion bread, bbq pork bun, and pineapple bun are very authentic. I grew up in Hong Kong and go back almost every year, so imagine my delight when I found a place in the US that did it right! They use the same ingredients and techniques that they do in Hong Kong, and the quality never falters.

I've also ordered a regular white/sponge cake from them, and it's pretty much perfect. The cake is soft yet firm, and the flavour is subtle. The icing/cream is very light unlike most American cakes, but that's what a Chinese cake is supposed to be like! They also use fresh fruit unlike some other bakeries (I saw them cutting the fruit in the kitchen), so that is a definite plus for your money.

There is a bit of seating inside the shop and newspapers to read if you're planning to stay, but there's quite a few parks and the botanical garden nearby which makes the location great for getting a snack with friends.

In case anyone didn't know, they bake their stuff fresh daily and never serve anything that was baked the day before, and so you know you're getting your money's worth! Highly recommended for anyone that's looking to try traditional Hong Kong baked goods without having to actually go to Hong Kong.
author: Yolanta S.

description: This bakery never disappoints me! My family and I always get our cakes here whether it's for a birthday or holiday. Sunset bakery always has cake already made and ready to go. Which I think is a great option. All you have to do is pick up your cake and pay ! And get writing on it if you wish ! :D
author: L R.

description: Even though I grew up on Sheng Kee, my heart belongs to Sunset Bakery and their delicious pineapple buns. Probably one of the first gems I discovered when I moved to the Sunset. No one else makes them quite as well as this bakery. Every bite is the perfect mix of crunchy crust and sweet moist bun. I could eat three in one sitting. I possibly hoard a few in the freezer for emergency pineapple bun cravings. At 70 cents a bun, this is an affordable luxury. I'm also a fan of their sponge cakes with strawberry filling.
author: Alice H.

description:
I came here today on a whim and saw that they had custard pie! OMG - it was a huge pie version of a egg tart! That was the first time I had seen that and I bought it ($7). This was a gift for my gf and I also got the strawberry cake slice and a cream bun for myself. They were all good and reasonably priced.

My only beef was they only take cash and I only had $10 and some change in my wallet. It was enough to purchase everything. In a way, it might have been a godsend if they didn't take credit cards... I would have bought the whole store!

Happy Eating!
author: Carolyn N.

description:
I've been coming here since I was little. All of their items are good. This is one of the first places I go to satisfy my Chinese bakery cravings when I'm back in San Francisco. None of the bakeries in LA/Orange County compare. Their fruit cakes are among the best in the city, but seem to get more and more expensive every day! :(

Depending on the staff that's working that day, their English might not be so great. I speak a little Chinese so it's not too difficult of a transaction if I'm just getting some bakery items, but sometimes I have trouble ordering a cake because they don't know what I'm trying to say. Again, this varies from day to day.
author: Christy Y.

description:
I've been comin here for years I usually wil get a cupcake and a little box of drink like a. Soymilk or chrysanthemum tea drink but today I was low on cash so I just bought a cup of hot water. The guys in the bakery were talking and having a good time and making a lot of cakes and there were at least 5 customers there while I was there drinking. My water which was no mor e than ten minutes 

I will definitely go back again and If you are trying to decide whether you should go here or Not or debating to or not I think you should go. I'm going to go back I love goIng to this place.
author: Jennifer G.

description: It ain't no Chinatown but it comes pretty close. Their buns are huge and always fresh, although they are a little yeasty for my preference, it hits the spot. Their egg tarts are also really good; obviously the custard part isn't as good as golden gate bakery but it's nice that I can just pop in to sunset bakery without standing in a ridiculous line or fighting traffic just to find out they are closed for vacation.
author: Christine H.

description: I don't understand why the rating is so dang high. They have way too much attitude. I've been here twice, won't go back. Their stuff is okay...not that great...I'll take my business elsewhere.
author: Kylie L.

description: I never liked Chinese sponge cakes until my cousin introduced me to the cakes from Sunset Bakery. I've had plenty of Chinese cakes before but nothing like the ones made at Sunset Bakery.  The ladies who work behind the counter are friendly too. These cakes are perfect for those who like light, airy cakes with fluffy whipped cream and fruit. They aren't overly sweet, which is perfect for me and my family. You can't go wrong with strawberry or mixed fruit, and what a steal at $18 per 8" cake.
author: Audrey T.

description:
I've been to numerous events that get their cakes from here! A small place, but don't be deceived. 
Their cakes are amazing! It isn't your typical Chinese bakery. The sponge cakes are perfectly light and the icing is never too sweet! 
The fruits taste fresh unlike those cakes with canned fruits that are sour and overglazed, yuck!
The staff is so kind, and they'll help you with whatever you need. 
Me and my mom have been coming here for years and we've never been let down. 
They have cakes and pastries for all occasions! There's a reason their reviews are so great. 
The prices are very reasonable as well!
Definitely recommend!
author: Veronica L.

description:
Best cocktail buns I've ever had in the Sunset - love the fact that they keep a bunch of items in a warmer, perfect for a foggy day in the Sunset (which amounts to nearly every day) 

Can't beat the prices. Out of the four bakeries by this little corner this is the best. Doesn't look like much but hey.
author: Mason S.

description: Love this bakery for their mixed fruit cake.. I'm not a super fan of cake and sweets . Always order their full sheet of cake (it's fluffy, not sweet and inexpensive)...My only problem is always have to have someone drive me to pick up cake as parking is hard.
author: CC S.

description: Wow! I called on Tuesday asking if it was too late to get a cake for Saturday. I had the strawberry cream cake at a friend's party the year before, and asked for the same thing. The lady on the phone recommended the size, and they wrote a nice message (with the correct spelling of my name) and it was ready on time. And, I got a delicious cake for 25+ people for only $33 (CASH ONLY). Add a couple of bucks for some candles (which they sell there) and boom! Job nicely done.
author: Mi M.

description:
I was introduced to their Taiwanese bread by my boss and decided to check the place out for myself. They have lots of yummy lunch/breakfast sandwiches and milk teas. I enjoyed my meal very much! 

*If you are not using cash, your order must be over $5.
author: Anna B.

description: Sunset Bakery is my goto place for birthday cakes. My favorite is the fresh strawberry cake. It's very light and not too sweet. Custard pie is very good as well. They also have delicious, big and flaky pineapple buns too. Everything is reasonably priced.
author: Katie L.

description:
Came here during finals week for an egg tart...and ended up buying a slice of strawberry cake, bbq pork bun, pineapple bun, cream bun, and the egg tart. All that for about $6.
