Their buns are so yummy!  I would eat their bread the same day to make sure the bread stays chewy and soft...thinking about it makes me hungry. 

1. Strawberry cake: not too sweet with pretty fresh strawberries, the cake itself is a little dry on the top later but moist on the bottom layer probably because of the strawberries. Cream is not too sweet, but the cake itself is sweet so it all worked out pretty well overall ($2.25 per slice)

2. Cream bun: was gonna save half for later but ended up eating the whole thing...bread is so good! They put some coconut flakes on top of the bread and cream in between. I had to scrape a lil bit of cream out when eating it but it was really good, couldn't stop eating it. Good with coffee if you have some. 

3. Pineapple bun: the top layer crust is flaky, sweet, and buttery. The bread is very soft and delicious, pretty much like any of their breads. More like cantonese style than taiwanese style pineapple bun.

4. BBQ pork bun: Kept heated and was warm when I got mine. The BBQ pork is pretty good, not too much fatty meat, quite tasty. The only thing I think I didn't like as much is the sweetness of the bun, would prefer it to be less sweet because the BBQ pork is already kinda sweet.

5. Egg tart: came here for this but was least impressed by it. Don't get me wrong, it's not bad, just did not stand out compare to their other buns.

Definitely will come back for more if i'm in the inner sunset!
author: Whitney W.

description:
CAKES!!!!!

Whether you want a slice of that spongey, not-too-sweet cake with buttercream and fruit or to book your WEDDING cake.  This is the place to go.

Total hole-in-the-wall, but looks are deceiving.  They provided me a beautiful three tier cake and sheet cake on time, exactly as requested (buttercream with a simple design and mixed fruit with a ribbon), and for about $350 bucks (188 guests).  DELISH!

Not a fan of sitting there and enjoying my cake though, due to the crazy homeless people that seem to wander in here and there.  But the cheap prices and delicious cakes keep me coming.
author: Christine K.

description:
My review is based solely on a strawberry cake slice recently purchased at the Sunset Bakery.  

I was walking in the neighborhood when I suddenly remembered that Jessica T had once written a review stating how delicious the strawberry cake was so I walked in and bought a couple of the strawberry cake slices (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/-BFRADVnhbnDgS7e_0KkfQ?select=cEXAwMw9gXiqMLsP4d5JYw).  The thin layer of whipped cream was kind of light, and the cake was moist and spongey.  Like many Asian bakeries the cake was not as sweet as cakes found at non-Asian bakeries.  The strawberries were crisp and tart which went well with the sweet cream.  At $2.00 a slice it is super affordable too.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description: Ok ok I've actually come here recently and tried a few of their pastries. Second time having the strawberry cake, and it was somehow less delicious.. Less fresh maybe. The macaroon was meh. Had the fruit tarts, and they were pretty good, a perfect little sweet snack with tea. Their tea apparently takes like 15 mins to make so they were not super eager about me ordering that. So I went home and made my own tea.
author: Vivian H.

description:
Upped to 5 stars.

Why, you ask?

I had no idea that they close at 6pm, so I called AT 6pm to try to pick up a cake by 6:30pm. They told me to come anyway and just knock on the door, and that someone would let me in.

Before I went, I had asked them to write a happy birthday message for one person, because I didn't realize that someone else with a birthday was coming to our gathering. I found this out as I walked out my front door to pick up the cake. When I went into the bakery (after closing, I might add!), I frantically asked them if they could add another name to the cake. They calmly and kindly obliged with my request, so the cake was saved! Not to mention that I was able to GET the cake in the first place.

Such nice people + great all-around baked goods = 5 star upgrade!
author: Angela K.

description:
PINEAPPLE BUNS FRESH OUT OF THE OVEN!!!!!!! 
Disclaimer for the non-Chinese (to avoid potential confusion): There is no pineapple in the pineapple bun. 

If you don't know, now you know. ;)
author: Denise L.

description:
The Best Strawberry Cake I've Ever Had!!! So happy that I've been able to enjoy their cakes for many, many, years! I guess it's good that it takes me an hour to get there cause if they were closer I'd probably be 500 pounds! 
Here's my tip: Be sure you have someone drive you so you can jump out and pick up the cake while your driver circles the neighborhood. Parking sucks!
author: Dee F.

description: Maybe I came on an off day or just old cake! The strawberry cake was good, soft, moist and not overly sweet. The chocolate cake on the other hand was total opposite, hard and dry. The cake had to be a few days old!!
author: Julie C.

description:
I gotta give this place 5 stars. Whenever I'm in the city, I always gotta pick up a Chinese fruit cake. Why? Because it's the only cake place I can afford off season (Off season= When its not a holiday, birthday, going-away cake, Jewish holiday, or being nice to your co-workers etc.). 

There are 2 kinds of Chinese fruit cake filling:
1) mixed fruit [pineapple, canned peaches (sounds gross, but it works!), strawberry, and other unknown fruits]
2) All strawberry 

Every single Chinese bakery in San Francisco has these two options, same price for either choice. What's great about Sunset Bakery though, is the PRICE. I've been to many many many bakeries... And one would think they're all the same--but they're not. I've been a long patron of Victor's Bakery for the past 20 years http://www.yelp.com/biz/victors-bakery-san-francisco but the cake prices shot up $5 thus making it out of my price range for OFF SEASON (and IN SEASON!). 

Sunset's price for a large cake was $19. $17 for a medium, AND wait for it... The middle aged Chinese woman spoke English*! She also has character. She is super nice and extremely chatty which is great, because after many Chinese establishment visits in SF... Well, needless to say it's like finding a diamond on top of a great big foggy hill. Oh that's SF! Let's just hope they keep the prices low and affordable so I can buy my cake every month during off season.


*enough for you to understand!
author: Jay L.

description:
YUM! 

My BFF and I went on a Chinese bakery tour where we sampled char siu bao and egg tarts until we couldn't muster another half bite.

The bao is delicious and has good texture. The meat was savory and not too sweet. The egg tart custard was very good and the crust was nice and flaky.  

My BFF declared that in his opinion, Sunset Bakery was the winner for that day's tour.
author: Melissa K.

description:
Another great find through Yelp.  I ordered my wedding cake here based on all the positive reviews and can't be any happier.  We got the fresh cream strawberry cake.  The cake itself was as light as air, not overly sweetened and the cream and strawberries were really fresh.  We were really pleased with the very reasonable cost for three layers compared to other wedding cake rival bakeries including Shubert's.  Unfortunately, you will not be able to order square shaped layers nor be too picky about an intricate design, but if quality and taste is more important, this is your place.  Delivery can be arranged but the staff is not too enthused about it.

I also recommend the mocha cake.  You can expect a friendly staff but parking is challenging.
author: Carmina B.

description:
This is my go-to bakery for any chinese bun or pastry! Things you must try:

pineapple bun 
ham and green onion bun
sponge cake
whole or slice of their strawberry cake 
egg tart (will get the job done if i dont wanna make my trek over to chinatown for golden gate bakery)

everything's cheap and I always leave happy with a pink box full of these goodies!

*tip: if you want some ham and green onion bun or sponge cake, try to go early in the morning ~9am or so on the weekends bc they always sell out! OR call in advance to reserve a box!
author: Patricia K.

description:
First place I ever had hot dog buns.

There might be better places out there but this quaint little shop will remain my favorite.
author: Richard B.

description:
The fruits cakes here are basically the definition of, well, fruits cakes.  Now, I'm talking about fruits cake, not to be confused with fruitcake, the nasty log of dried fruit and nuts and candied crap people give as awful presents around Christmas time.  

The cake here is fluffy light white sponge cake layered with cream and fruit.  It's never too sweet, which is somewhat dangerous because it gives you the feeling that you can eat the whole cake by yourself. (Tried, I have).

People love this cake.  Case in point, my two friends who are a couple would, without fail, always ask me to get a birthday cake for each other's "surprise" party every year. Three years and six cakes later, neither of them appear to be showing any signs of birthday fruits cake fatigue.  And frankly, NEITHER AM I.

tl;dr: Amazing fruits cake for cheap.
author: jon y.

description: The strawberry cake is the best around, bar none!  The cream is not overly sweet, unlike other Asian bakeries.  They also have egg tarts, BBQ pork buns, and a plethora of other pastries.  Prices are on the pricier side, but as the old saying goes, "you get what you pay for".  And Sunset Bakery delivers on both quality, and taste!  Definitely recommend them for special occasion cakes, such as birthdays, and weddings.
author: Dub L.

description: I have been looking for a decently price cake shop that doesn't make overly sweet desserts. Can we say Jack pot! I've purchased two cakes from here and although the workers don't speak English well, they are friendly. But some fair warning they only except cash. But seriously the cakes are so light, fluffy and make you coming back for more. This is my go to place when ordering cakes now, no more safeway or baskin robin cakes for me.
author: Victoria Y.

description:
7X7 SF's The Big Eat 2012 List (100 Things You Must Eat in San Fran) names a Chinese bakery in the Mission for stellar coconut buns - also known as cocktail buns. I beg to differ. Having trekked all the way to the Mission to try the supposed delight, I was underwhelmed. The standard for all cocktail buns, instead, should be those from Sunset Bakery. I've been a patron (though in my formative elementary school years, it was my parents who were patrons because they had money) of Sunset Bakery for going on twenty years. Their pastries'  tastes have stayed the same for all those years. They haven't reduced the size or quality of their items and yet the price feels like highway robbery. It's not the same price as that of the late 1980s (yes I just dated myself) but you have to account for inflation. 

Their cocktail bun is warm and the filling is gooey with coconut, sesame seed goodness. The ratio of gooey filling to bread is just right: 50/50. The warm buns that sell out the fastest in the morning are....Pshaw like I'm going to post them and let them disappear even faster. When I came here at 12 pm one day, they had already sold out of my favorite items. Just take my word that everything is good and try not to buy the cocktail buns, BBQ pork buns, green onion & ham twist, or black bean bun before I get here at 2 pm ok? ;-)

Parking gets difficult on Saturdays and Sundays due to the crowds in the 9th and Irving area. You'll have to resign yourself to metered parking. 

And no credit cards.
author: Gwen L.

description:
$17 for the smaller strawberry filled cake.  I always refer to them as the "Asian fluffy sponge fruit cakes".  They also have a mixed fruit.  If you're looking for this style of fruit cake then Sunset is the place to go. Good amount of fillin & they have just the perfect light amount of cream.  Free personalization and you don't necessarily have to pre-order unless you need a larger sized sheet cake.  In my opinion they beat out Tart to Tart, Sheng Kee and Sweet Passion in the Sunset neighborhood.  

Other items to try: BBQ meat buns, ham & corn buns, pineapple buns etc.  

Parking can be quite hard ,so I usually just double park next door or even take my chances in the bus zone.  You'll be in and out in minutes if there's no line.
author: Stacey L.

description:
LIttle bakeries like these are one of the many things that called me back to San Francisco. A small but cute, totally unpretentious bakery stuffed with both sweet & savory pastries.

I purchased two delicious baked goods. My first being a safe choice, a BBQ pork bun. A little sweet, a little salty and very savory. Everything a pork bun should be. The second was a new choice for me, a ham & green onion roll. The roll is more of a braid with ham & green onion throughout. The cured ham is salty and dense, reminding me of Canadian bacon. The green onion provides an equally strong flavor in contrast to the ham. It was fantastic.

If you happen to be in the area, looking for a quick bite I highly recommend. Great treats with great prices.
author: Paul K.

description:
SUNSET BAKERY is a great addition to the wonderful restaurants in the INNER SUNSET. The cake is delicious! I always get my birthday cakes here! Since I live in the area and went to the school in the area, a lot of my friends and family know about this place. To the point where every time I go to a birthday party or celebration gathering a SUNSET BAKERY cake is there! What I like about this cake is how light and flavorful it is. American Cakes are very hearty and they can be good sometimes, but the way these Chinese Bakers make the cake are down right amazing!

I'm turning 21 next month, and i'm truly excited to order my birthday cake her once again. =] I'm planning on ordering three sheets of different sizes and have a 3 tier cake! WHOO HOO, yes I'm going BIG for my 21st! I'm excited!

Well anyways, I highly recommend ordering your cakes from SUNSET BAKERY. Not to mention, the price is very reasonable. If I could recall, a whole sheet is $40. I'm not sure though, that's the price of the cake I usually order anyways. 

SO YAH, take my advice and come here! i'm like a fat kid that loves cake. =] I KNOW my stuff!
author: Briana H.

description:
Risk getting parking ticket at the door!

Best cha siew bow in the 'hood, enormous with GENEROUS filling.  AND, quite excellent apple pies, as well as creamy light shortcake style layer cakes.

-because everything is so very freshly baked!

Enjoy.
author: Clifford L.

description: hmm, im definitely missing something here. i ordered a myriad of things that were seemingly their most popular - strawberry shortcake, chocolate cake, and bean cake pastry. the strawberry cake was good, but not out of this world. i think the best thing about this place are the prices - they are very reasonable. however, with that said, i would probably not come back...
author: Asmita J.

description:
If you know me, you'll know I have an eternal egg tart craving. Having been deprived for awhile, I was looking forward to getting my hands on some today! Since SF's egg tart mecca, Golden Gate Bakery, is closed on vacation (thanks for the heads up, fellow Yelpers!), so my friends and I decided to take a gamble and try out Sunset instead.

As soon as I stepped through the door, I felt something was off. The place was empty and a bit dingy, which is nothing out of the ordinary for Chinese places, but what really struck me was the dismal selection. Even within the small counter, a good amount of the items were entirely American! Cupcakes and poppyseed muffins are good in their own right, but... here?

Maybe I'm spoiled from New York Chinatown, but when I think Chinese bakery, I think long, bright counters filled with Chinese treats, and this definitely wasn't it. Regardless, we decided to give them a chance and bought a box of nine egg tarts.

My first impression wasn't bad. The crust was nice and soft, which I prefer over the flaky type, but it was only downhill from there! The custard itself didn't taste eggy enough; it looked fine, but biting into it was like biting into a vaguely egg-tart flavored milk pudding. Disappointing.
author: Grace K.

description: The BBQ pork buns are great! They're $1.50 and the filling is pretty good quality. Better than Kee Wah Bakery which has the weird pink filling inside... The pineapple bun is the best I've had! It's a little too sweet so half of one will satisfy my craving. The woman at the counter grabbed fresh warm buns for me which was great!
author: Emma H.

description: I got the strawberry cake for my girlfriend and it was light and fluffy! One of the best strawberry cakes I have ever had, and would definitly come back again.
author: Thomas L.

description:
This is the closest bakery to me and it's pretty decent.  

They make/sell everything that you'd expect from a Chinese bakery.  My personal favorite is the egg tart.  At just $0.70 each, it's a very fair price.  They also have slices of cake for $2.25 and slices of the cake roll for just $1.  Other baked goods include muffins, cookies, etc.  I have not found anything super stand-out, but everything is pretty good.  

Note:
They put most items into a small paper bag; better be careful if you're getting cake- sometimes it can get smashed in the baggie.
author: Samantha L.

description:
This place is great. Whenever I'm waiting for the bus at the corner of 9th and Judah, this is the place to go if you want something good, cheap, fast, and filling to eat.

Get a bun (bao) here. Char Siu (pork bun) is always good, Ham and corn is great, my favorite place to get it. It's bigger and better here, more corn and ham on this one than at Cafe Bakery, and cheaper. 

They have cakes here as well. Ever have a birthday, you can pre-order or just go on the day. I prefer "Asian cakes" just because they are less heavy on the cream. Costco cake is the worst. 

The ladies here are very nice. I've been there so much, they remember me.
author: Leanne K.

description: This has been my go-to strawberry cake place since I was a baby. All I can say is, thank you for creating this invention, Sunset Bakery. My world is better with your cake here. Even when I can't have it, knowing it exists makes everything... ok.
author: Vicky T.

description:
I had my wedding cake made here recently! My main reason for choosing this place was they were affordable and their cake is pretty good.

Pros:
-affordable!! (2 tier feeds 60-80 people $160, 3 tier feeds 80-120 $210, 4 tier feeds 150-200 $295, 5 tier feeds 200-250 $380, 6 tier feeds 250-280 $415, 7 tier feeds 300-350 $520, 8 tier feeds 350-380 $570)
-cake is light and fluffy

Cons:
-not a lot of flavors to choose from for wedding cake
-I don't think they use fondant, we had butter cream on ours which they said is good outside of a fridge for about 4 hours
-they don't decorate your cake besides the basics (my bridesmaids placed the flowers and cake toppers on for me the day of the wedding)
-you have to return the plastic columns they use to separate the tiers (they charge a fee for this and you get your money back if you return them, but we forgot)
author: Cindy C.

description:
Quick desserts to go. I usually get the cupcakes with plastic rings. I get them mainly for the rings. 

Really cheap pastries. I'm glad there is a Chinese bakery around this area.
author: Mandy D.

description:
I've had their strawberry cake and the taste & price is perfect!

I'm Korean and I grew up with Paris Baguette-like fruit cakes. Asian cakes are light and usually topped with fruit. PB isn't in SF (yet) so I was really glad to find Sunset Bakery. Their strawberry cake is light, fluffy and delicious. 

Unsure of their other baked goods, but if you're an Asian cake lover you should try their strawberry cakes!
author: Rosa L.

description:
I ordered my wedding cake and bridal shower cake from Sunset Bakery. I found Sunset Bakery on yelp while searching for an inexpensive wedding cake baker. Most bakeries I researched charged upwards of $4 per slice and Sunset Bakery was by far the least expensive option I came across. 

For the wedding cake, we paid approximately $340 for a 5-tier cake (serves 200), which included delivery to Fisherman's Wharf. The basic price was less but there are surcharges for different flavors. The counter girl was pretty helpful in explaining the pricing and gave us a sample of the type of ribbon that works best with the frosting. 

Unfortunately, the bakery doesn't have samples of most of their flavors. I was considering the chestnut filling for one of the layers of our wedding cake but couldn't sample it. Instead, I ordered it for my bridal shower cake and found that I didn't care for the flavor. I was expecting it to be like the chestnut cream cake from Sheng Kee (one of my faves), but the chestnut filling had a heavy consistency and the texture was kind of chunky. The cake was light and moist though. 

For our wedding cake, we chose chocolate with strawberries, yellow with strawberries, and chocolate with mocha cream. The designs are fairly simple, but I was more concerned about how the cake tasted. The cake again was really light and moist, the frosting wasn't too sweet, and the strawberries were fresh. We received rave reviews from our guests.

A couple things to keep in mind, they only take cash, and, they refund $25 when you return the cake dowels.
author: Vivian A.

description: I agree with the other yelpers who love their sponge cakes. It really is hard to produce consistently fresh sponge cakes that are so fluffy. They are light and airy, topped with nothing but  whipped cream (none of the thick frosting stuff) and fruit, and represent the definition of a sponge cake. The freshness is evident when the edges of the cake are just as fluffy as the middle of it as sponge cakes tend to stale at the edges pretty quickly. Don't get me wrong- I'm a sweet tooth so I have a spot for dense, rich chocolate cakes as much as the next person, but when I'm looking for a light cake, this is the one.
author: Jocelyn L.

description: If you love a light, fluffy, spongy, and tasty choice of cake... SUNSET BAKERY is the place to be!
author: Virginia L.

description:
I love the sponge cakes and the birthday cakes.  Light & airy. And great BBQ pork buns too.

Parking can be difficult to find; but definitely worth giving it a try.
author: Shirley N.

description:
Mmm... Stumbled upon this place while checking out my friend's new apartment in the Sunset. I was really craving a pineapple bun, and the first bakery I walked past didn't have any. When I popped into Sunset Bakery, I didn't see any behind the counter, but thank goodness I asked the friendly staff, otherwise I would not have discovered the fresh batch they were keeping in the back! The bun was fresh, chewy, and moist. My only complaint was the crust, as I prefer a crispy, flakier layer.

I'll definitely drop by again the next time I visit my friend. Also, after reading all the Yelp reviews, I'll also have to try the strawberry sponge cake.
author: Elaine C.

description:
It's been a year since my last review and I'm still an avid fan of Sunset Bakery.  I've been coming here for over 20 years to fulfill all of my chinese bakery needs.  I love it all.  My family and friends have come to love this bakery as well.     

I will take any opportunity to have a slice of cake from Sunset Bakery so I bought one for my coworker's birthday and was pleasantly surprised to see the entire cake decorated with LOTS of green lime gel.  I LOVE THIS STUFF.  I always ask for it when I order a cake and they must know.   I love this lime gel so much that I would have licked it all off..... but it's not my birthday and it's not my cake.  So, I stopped myself and resolved to get a cake just for me soon.  

The cake was amazing as always.  Not too sweet, with real whipped cream frosting, ethereal airy fluffy white cake, fresh strawberries and my favorite lime gel.  Everyone loved it.  Simple, elegant and delicious.  

Thank you Sunset Bakery for the extra lime gel. :)  I appreciate that you recognized that I'm the lime green gel girl and for that I'll always be a fan.
author: Marie L.

description: The snacks and dessert is good test! We also book the big cake from here will sent to us next weekend, then I will write review later
author: Momoko S.

description:
SO CHEAP. SO DELICIOUS. TOTALLY AMAZEBALLS CHA-SIU BAO. AAAAAAAH

I live for places like this :P

I love Chinese bakeries. Cha siu bao is a total comfort food of mine, and WOW Sunset bakery  does them right. :) I also like their dan tat (egg tart), but I do prefer Golden Gate Bakery (but they're so far awayyyyy D:)

My mom likes their almond cookies. I like their sponge cake (it's a little more egg-ey than I'm used to, but the moistness and the lightness of it ROCKS). There are a million other things I want to try there! I've gotta come here on a weekend and just stock up on pastries pastries pastries :P

Good thing this place is a couple uphill/downhill blocks from where I live. If it was any closer, I'd be there all day erryday.
author: Jade R.

description:
What is a celebratory meal without cake?   At best, I guess it could be acceptable, but it would ultimately be incomplete.  And who wants to leave a party feeling that way?

Now that the importance of cake is established, a distinction must be made when to break out the ultra rich, calorie laden, super dessert and when to have a simpler cake to properly end a small get together.
 
If it's the latter, Sunset Bakery is an excellent option: they're renowned for their strawberry shortcake.
First of all, just because it's not rich and decadent, it doesn't mean it's not a good cake.  Believe me, it's one scrumptious dessert.
What gets me is how so light the cake and frosting taste.  So light in fact, I'm almost obliged to have more than one slice because something this airy can't be all that bad for you.

And for the price and flavor and feelings of euphoria, I'm thinking I should buy their strawberry shortcake more often - like every other week more often.

Moreover, their strawberry shortcake is such a nice pick me up that it should not be limited to having an occasion.
It's just one of those things that are nice to have once in awhile.
Here some possible reasons I'm thinking of getting another:
It's Tuesday
or
It's Thursday
or
Work Sucks Day
or
Me Want Food
or
*insert own reason here*
author: Dan B.

description: Everything is awesome!! Sunset bakery is my regular. I love the strawberry cake, that is cute and yummy. For breakfast, I like the sponge cake and tuna bun. Price is reasonable. Customer service is great too!! You can not miss it
author: MC K.

description:
very very yum, when going there, i couldn't resist getting a little of everything when I went there.

Items i got
Cinnimon Twist
Mocha Cake
2 Pineapple buns
2 pork buns

I gotta say that everything was super good. Cake was tasty and monist. Cinnimon Twist was pretty good. Pineapple Buns were freshly baked!!

unfortunately could not eat the pork buns....my dogs grabbed it before i could ...sad

but over all great place.

I just wished they accepted credit cards =(
author: Lex M.

description:
I come here all the time, specifically for their amazing pork buns. I have tried perhaps a dozen pork buns from china town, from sunset and everywhere in between, and I think these are absolutely the best. They are of a higher quality, you will taste the difference when you try one. I always tell the nice lady, who I can only assume owns the place, that her bow are the best I've ever had.

Sunset Bakery: best baked cha siu bow in SF.
author: Cortland T.

description:
As far as I can tell the best bakery in the Sunset in San Francisco.  Pretty good chocolate cake logs, and cheaper than at Sheng Kee.  Excellent egg tarts.

And above all else, a beautiful, delicious, and cheap wedding cake for our wedding!  Their fruit cake was exactly the way I remember fruit cake at Chinese bakeries should be from my childhood- fluffy, fruity, tasty.  And the cake looked beautiful too.
author: Jeff T.

description:
So I had lunch at Park Chow down on the 9th street and I was craving cupcakes.  I used my Yelp application on my Blackberry and when I put in cupcakes this place came up.  Wow thats a lot of reviews and high ones! 

We walked down the street and came to this place that looks like its straight out of Chine town.  There is a sign on the wall that says CASH ONLY NO BANKCARDS OR CHECKS ACCEPTED.  But that's okay because this place is super cheap!

No ambiance what so ever but they are good at what they do.  If you feel like a light greatly tasting desert come here.  I got a fruit tart that was 1.75 which is easily sold at frou frou desert places for 5.00 and my friend got a chocolate eclaire where she was practically licking her fingers for less than 2.00 

When we were eating there for and just chatting it up I swear so many people came in and picked up a cake.  It must be their specialty! 

The desert is just so refreshing.  Loved it.
author: Anya R.

description:
They have a mini baked pork bun for 70 cents that is less sweet than pork buns from Clement Restaurant. It just has slices of lean bbq pork in a mild "pork bun" sauce. No big chunks of onion, less fat than most pork buns. 

Each one comes on its own little paper-cup wrapper. (3+" wide)

Order larger quantities a day ahead. I ordered 20 for this morning and had to wait an extra 15 minutes from when they said they'd be ready. (only an issue if you have to be somewhere at a certain time, which I did)

They open at 8:00am on Sunday and can't have them ready until at least 9:00am. 

They are delicious and worth a trip across the park to try. 

I smuggled a few extra home with me, which I will now reheat & eat. gleek.
author: Blue R.

description:
Dear Sunset Bakery:

Your pineapple buns, pork buns and fruit-filled sponge cake to name a few are hands down the best in the neighborhood.
author: J. C.

description: Actually closes at 5:30! But the baker was SOOO kind to open up right before 6 and let me buy a cake! Awesome cake and awesome service.
author: Tammy T.

description:
I can't reiterate enough what a true tasty gem this place is.

They're professional, adorable, and extremely skilled.

I bought my "Fabulousity" strawberry cream sponge Birthday cake here for just 19 dollars.

The frosting was light and fresh, and superbly spread. The strawberries were fresh and juicy. And the sponge was a cloud.

And the best part - the service. There's no extra charge to personalize your cake. They'll box it up nicely, and they'll go out of their way to make sure you're happy with your purchase.

Fabulousity and then some.
author: Jessica T.

description:
Never was a ca-ake girl (thank you Tori Amos, for the accompanying tune). As a kid, I'd tell my mom that I only wanted ice cream at my birthday parties; she'd compromise by getting one of those ice cream cakes from Baskin Robbins. For me, it's rarely the cake itself that's the problem... it's the FROSTING that cake makers just seem to go unnecessarily buckwild with! Most cake icings and frostings are just too sweet, sugary, or heavy for me. Slice for you, ma'am? Thanks, I think I'll pass... no cake for Kate :(

UNTIL.

At my last job, every time there was a big party or celebration of some sort, my boss would ask me to order a half or full sheet cake from Sunset Bakery. The first time I reluctantly accepted a small slice after gorging myself on the preceding meal, I was pleasantly surprised to find how light, fluffy, and manageable the cake was. AND, the frosting was just as light--sweet, yet not artificial tasting. And they topped everything with all sorts of fresh fruit--yummm! I probably went back for a piece double the size of the first!

The sheet cakes can be ordered in either mocha or mixed fruit flavor. Both are topped with fresh fruit and deeelicious. You can order ahead to have them squeeze a little celebration message on top, and if you plan to be regular customers like my old work, ask if you might be able to get a small discount (we always got one).

Thanks to Sunset Bakery, now I can have my cake AND eat it too!
author: Kate V.

description:
Wife's parent is having an 30th wedding anniversary. Therefore as the loving-daughter, she did all the necessary arrangement for a memorable anniversary gathering, including calling and picking up a cake from one of the parent's favorite Chinese bakeries in San Francisco. With many positive reviews, this bakery is also a favorite of Yelp with the sticker on the glass door. 

I'm not too fond of enjoying dinner or any special gathering at their crib. Her parents obviously love her daughter and our kids, but not me. 

Why?  

"Matt is too condescending, arrogant and "way" too "Joe Cool" for them." You can easily tell that our wedding and my graduate from the academy was bit rough getting my family and her family to get along. "Hey, I pay most of the bills around the house and feed my kids cupcakes! Do I get any respect?"

At their crib, the whole family and relatives chatted and reminiscing the past and other BS in the living room. While me, I was in my wife's childhood and occasional bedroom to privately enjoy the slice of Sunset Bakery's Strawberry Cake by my lonesome self. The strawberry cake has chunks of fresh strawberries and a thick ass cream and frosting for design that makes Elizabeth Faulkner to be thrill. Unfortunately, my slice of cake has a heart symbol on that slice. Hopefully with that heart shape on that slice, her parents will respect me as a real gentleman and true father and loving husband and not as a "thug" or a "gangsta-asian". 

For a Chinese-style dessert, that unique slice of cake was very fresh with the colorful strawberries and tasty despite enjoying the treat on enemy's turf. Wife also bought a 12 pack of egg custard tart for my family to enjoy for breakfast for the next couple of days. The $1.00 tart may be on the same page with Chinatown's Golden Gate Bakery, but still it was piping hot and fresh. Since this is a Chinese bakery, she paid her $20.00 cake and $12.00 custards in cash. 

We don't come out to the Sunset often, but this Chinese bakery is one of the better ones in that area.
author: Matt G.

description: This bakery is famous for their strawberry sponge cake and several pies. For many years it's been one of my family's favorite places to pickup a strawberry cake for special occasions (ie. bday, anniversary, parties, etc.), other than Schubert's. This small store also sells both western and Chinese pastries. My father first brought me here when I was young. He would normally get a slice of the lemon curd cake, and I'd get an apple struedel or a BBQ pork bun. Also in my opinion, they sell one of the BEST egg custard pies and mini egg custard tarts in the city. All food items are reasonably priced, so u get a good value.
author: Luis C.

description:
Do you ever need to supply cake for a large gathering?  Are you sick and tired of the generic Costco cakes?  Then Sunset Bakery is your answer.  The cakes are the spongy -- almost like angel food cake -- texture, very light, with a nice vanilla flavor.  Frosting is (real) whipped cream, and they decorate the cakes with fresh strawberries.  They'll also add any greetings you wish.  You can get traditional round cakes (medium serves about 8, large serves about 12).  

For large groups, I've ordered 1/2 sheets and full sheet cakes and they were eagerly gobbled by the event participants.  (I also noticed that people didn't leave behind the icing, as is the case with the Costco too-sweet frosting cakes.)  

In addition to the white cake, you can also request chocolate -- it's not a deep, rich chocolate like you'd get at Tartine, but rather a chocolate-flavored sponge cake.  Even still, it's yummy.  

Prices are very reasonable -- call them for quotes (be patient -- some of the workers here don't speak English).  Bring cash -- they don't take credit cards.  

When you pick up your cake, buy a pork bao for you and your driver for the trip home.  

Four stars only for two reasons: 
1) parking really sucks -- it's good to go with someone who will wait in the car while you block someone's driveway, otherwise, you'll be tempted to park in the bus zone, where you're guaranteed a ticket on this heavily patrolled street. 
2) I wish the premises were a bit less grimy -- like so many other similar independent bakeries, it really needs a deep steam cleaning.
author: Bevy M.

description:
The people are really nice and run a good business.  They are located in a busy area so parking was always hard to find.  I recently purchased a 3 tier birthday cake from them and it was WAY cheaper than any other place ($200).  They do deliver for a $50+ (minimum) depending on how far your location is, but I say get the cake on pillars and transport it yourself.  Or that's what we did at least.  Yes, it may be a bit of a stress factor, but we did it just fine without one single dent.  Just make sure to have PLENTY PLENTY PLENTY of towels or THICK blankets and a CLEARED out trunk.

You can see all the little holes and such on the cake, so they do not use the fondant that the majority of bakeries use out there now a days, so the visual quality isn't as great (-1 star), but hey ... you get what you pay for.  (And to be honest, $200 for a 3 tier white cake with fresh fruit and cream filling -- I can say that we got more for our buck at this place.)

You do have to return the pillars during the next following days or they will keep your deposit (they have you put down a deposit for them, ours was about $25).  Also they must be clean or they take half of your deposit.  I think that this is a great idea seeing as to how people don't ever need those pillars anyways ... they just get thrown away, when we had to pay extra for them.  So instead you pay a deposit to "borrow" them and then return them when your done.  Genius.

Also  this place is cash only, so if you did want to get a cake then the order must be placed at least 2 weeks in advance and paid in full with cash.

The cake itself tasted great.  The white cake was very soft and the filling, very creamy.  The fruit still tasted very fresh and everyone was delighted.

Although I have not had a chance to really try any of their other pastries, I might be going back in soon for a visit.  If their cake was that good I'm going to assume that the rest of their selection is up to par as well.

I'll be visiting again soon ... and as always if there's anything new, I'll update.

(I'll also post pictures of the cake once I get them from the photographer =).)
author: Pia V.

description:
05.16.13 

This visit i picked up orders for some of my co-workers.  

Still my goto place for pineapple buns, pork buns, and birthday cakes.

Service is friendly and quick.
author: Jay R.

description:
What place would have a cake ready in 20 minutes? Not just any cake... But REAL GOOD CAKE. 

Yes- thank God they exist.. The cakes are PHENOMENAL and delicious. Light, fluffy, and made with REAL whipped cream. The strawberry cake is just plain delicious. 

Get it. You can do no wrong. It's inexpensive-- got a half sheet cake that served about 14 or so people for like $30. Got a smaller round cake (9" I believe) that served 9 or 10 for like $18 or so. Don't quote me on the prices- I just know I was pleasantly surprised. 

And a tasty BBQ pork bun- nice and HUGE!
author: Coco C.

description:
I recently got married and yelp helped me find my perfect wedding cake.  

Never having been here, I stopped by with my then fiance for a tasting.  

He doesn't like cake but devoured the strawberry cake slice.  So I took a few samples home for the family and everyone loved it.  And the best part?  The price.  Wedding anything is overpriced, let alone cake.  My cake was very very affordable, delicious and beautiful.  I ordered a few dozen coconut (?) rolls in case I needed more but it turned out beautiful.  

The people here are super friendly, patient and helpful.  They were very easy to work with and very helpful.  I'm very pleased and highly recommend their cakes for birthdays, weddings, anything!  

Thank you Sunset Bakery (and yelpers)!
author: OLGA M.

description:
Simply the best Chinese bakery around. 

I always come here to get my mom's birthday cake. They make the best sponge cake here, light and fluffy. You can't go wrong with the Strawberry sponge cake. Light real cream frosting and filling and very fresh strawberries.
author: Maria M.

description:
Probably one of, if not the, best bakery that I go to!

Their pineapple and cocktail buns are always soft and fresh, so you know that they haven't been sitting in that little heater/oven box for very long.  They also make some great cakes here...always very moist and light.  They never get too heavy with the cream/frosting, nor is the taste overly sweet like some places.  I haven't tried their mixed fruit cake (generally not a fan), but their strawberry cakes (with or without the kiwi) are good.

But what I LOVE best about this place are their strawberry and custard pies!  It's cheap, delicious, and full of awesomeness.  Usually, my family will fall back on this as our default birthday "cakes" because you can never go wrong.  We've been coming here for years, and the people are always so nice and friendly.  And as long as they keep filling their food with the same awesomeness and stay friendly, I will keep coming back for years!
author: Mike L.

description:
My family has been getting birthdats cakes here for a good 10+ years now and we dont plan on stopping anytime soon. 

Their cakes are soft and light and not too sweet. 

What I really liked was the service. One year, I had to order my daughter's birthday cake last minute. I was hoping they had a blank cake ready that I coud just purchase then and there. The woman working behind the counter said they didnt but if i could wait 20mins, they'll have a new cake for me. I waited about 10mins and they had everything all ready, decorations and writing included. I was pleasantly surprised! 

The price is also very cheap.
author: Jean T.

description:
Sometimes I don't like eating high end upscale cakes. Sometimes I don't like spending $4 on a cupcake. Sometimes I like good old spongie, cheap, Chinese cake. 

We got a birthday cake from Sunset Bakery. It was round, white whipped frosting, sponge cake, and fruit filling with the words Happy Birthday on it. It was $16. Fantastic. They also have some cute pastries. Their coconut maroons are amazing. 3 for $1. What a deal! Highly recommend this place for office birthdays or simple birthdays or when you want good ol Chinese sponge cake.
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
BEST CHINESE BAKERY IN THE CITY PERIOD. I'm pretty sure they have the best pineapple buns in the Sunset, if not the entire SF, and I've had a good amount of pineapple buns in my life. I love their onion twists, and they also have this bread called the "Mexican bun' - it's like a less sweet version of the pineapple, and I love it. Their plain dinner buns are soo fluffy and delicious. I love going to Sunset Bakery for buns and then having them with a latte at another cafe. 

The prices are extremely reasonable - it's like $0.50 for a pineapple bun, as opposed to Shengkee's $2 ones that are only HALF as food as Sunset Bakery's. 

I can't exactly hang out at the bakery because it's frequented by the owner's friends, and though they're all really nice, they love laughing and talking kind of loud, so it's hard to have your own conversations when they're there with their grandchildren. All in all, I highly recommend this place!
author: Christine A.

description:
I have to say as a mindful person with what I consume, this place has the cakes that takes all cakes when it comes to light and not too sweet pastries. This place may not focus much on the interior decorations, but they make up with what they make in the bakery I will say that, Sunset bakery definitely have guilt free sweets, just the right amount of everything.

FYI- The Mandarin Orange pie with light custard and whipped cream is addictive, it is a MUST! not to mention it cost $9 and can serve about 8 people.
author: Hao N.

description:
I ordered my wedding cake 2 months before the wedding. Prices were very reasonable and cake was good for a Chinese sponge cake. We ended up spending about $1.50 (out the door) per guest for the cake. To give an idea, we had a 4 tier, strawberry filling cake, deliver outside SF. Cake was very moist, though the restaurant cut slices super thin, I didnt see any strawberry in my piece (no fault to Sunset Bakery). They delivered to Milbrae on time with no issues. Many of my guest thought the cake was an American cake too! They were quite impressed :) 

NOTE: Sunset Bakery does do floral decorations on cake. Your florist or someone you know has to do it.
author: Jen T.

description: Absolutely love this place. The Coconut cream buns are great as were all the pastries I purchased today. Everything is very reasonably priced and exceptional quality for the price.
author: Daniel C.

description:
Being chinese, this is one of those places that reminds me of the days where my grandpa would go get a coffee and a bun. It has that old school chinese bakery smell. Anyhow the review:
All i have to say is that anything hot is heaven and any cake in the fridge is heaven too.  Their cakes are sooo soft you can lay your head on it, and the frosting is soo light whipped cream it's your eating air. Of course my wife being the opposite likes the thick, heavy, cake, cuz thats what cake is supposed to be, according to her.
So if you like light fluffy cake with light fluffy whip cream frosting this is the place. if you like buttercream frosting go to citizen cake or shuberts. 

For me, a pineapple bun and a milk brings me back to being 10 again.

The only negative i have about this place is parking sucks, you can either test your luck by parking at the bus stop, run in and hope you can extricate fast or spend the rest of your life going in circles, trying to find parking.
author: ToAsTy T.

description: Love Love this small bakery in the Sunset. One of my dearest friends birthday and I wanted something different to mark this special occasion. My BFF had raved about their mocha cake so I decided to buy her one of her very own. I called and ordered (super easy) and realized when I was picking up we would have more guest. They are very accommodating to my needs and happen to have strawberry cake available too. Let me just say the birthday girl super happy with her two cakes. Both had writing, both were delicious. Everyone raved about the mocha and the kids loved the strawberry cake with the yummiest pieces of strawberries throughout the cake. Yes, I had two pieces one of each and will be ordering their cakes for future engagements.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
I LIKE BIG BUNS AND I CANNOT LIE.

Now that I've got everyone's attention...

Man, been going to this bakery since I was barely tall enough to see the glass cake display and it's still great.  I make a stop every time I go home to see the 'rents.

BUNS:  Mmmmm. Pineapple Bun.  Weird that the English name for Bo-luo bao is Pineapple Bun when really, there's no pineapple in it... maybe because it looks like a pineapple? Either way, delicious.  Also yummy green onion rolls, cocktail bun (I mean c'mon how can you NOT love butter and coconut slathered together?) and their sponge cakes are not bad.  Definitely better than the crazy dense sweet birthday cakes you get at Safeway or the like.  This place is Dr. Atkins' worse nightmare and a carb wh*re's dream.  Perfect for me!

AMBIENCE: Small, crowded, and looks EXACTLY as it did 20+ years ago.  I guess these ladies' mantra is if it ain't broke, don't fix it.  I guess there's nothing to fix too because no matter when I come, even when they open at 7 in the morning, there's a line out the door.  Chinese contractors in their paint-stained overalls and baseball caps that they got for free at the casinos (c'mon Chinese people you KNOW this is true and you're probably related to someone who fits this description) still make daily stops here.  Service...well... let's say it's one of those places where you either shout your order, or point to what you want, then get your food and get the heck outta there! Oh and make sure you have cash, I don't believe they accept credit cards here because well... Chinese people like green...

PRICES: Which is ok because sheezus where else in the city do you get breakfast for under a buck.  At least, that was how much stuff was when I visited a month ago.  Buns are under a dollar and feed a grown man.  There's also a variety to choose (I just listed the veggie ones) so you have a rather choice menu at hand for cheap. Beats the hell outta Mickey D's dollar menu any day!

PARKING: Is definitely a force to contend with if you don't live here. That said, I imagine most people walk here.  Good think the neighborhood is fairly walkable - there's also a bus that stops right outside AND across the street from the bakery.
author: Catherine C.

description:
This is another pork bun place that I like to go to. In fact, it's my #1 place (Cafe Bakery comes a close second.) Like many yummy pork bun places, you gotta get there early or they run out. They also close at 6, so be careful.

OH! The strawberry cake is pretty yummy too.
author: Joanne R.

description:
This review is about Sunset Bakery's pork buns.

Excellent!   Can we give Sunset Bakery 10 stars?  I've been eating SF pork buns (chao xiao bao) since I was in diapers, and my family and I have tried pork buns from every restaurant possible.  These are the * best * pork buns ever!  Time to put the "Which Bay Area restaurant / bakery has the best Chinese BBQ pork buns?" discussion to rest because Sunset Bakery is FTW.  The buck stops here.  Stick a fork in it, it's done.  This place is LEGIT.

The large BBQ pork buns are $1.00 each.  The pork buns are absolute perfection.  Perfectly baked, sweet bread with a generous heaping of deliciously marinated Chinese BBQ nestled inside the bun.  The outside is a golden brown, soft and sweet.

The buns are freshly baked.  I once came in and asked for 2 dozen pork buns and they said they'd make and bake it fresh for me right then and there.  Of course I waited for 20 minutes, but TOTALLY worht the wait.

Also, the pork buns are HUGE.  Forget those little pork buns that are $.60, $.80, or even $1.10.  These pork buns, especially out of the oven when they're all fluffy and warm, are like... the size of my face!  Granted I'm not a huge giant of a person, but these pork buns are bigger than my palm.  You get the bang for your buck AND there isn't any sacrifice on taste, quantity or quality.

As for their cakes-- DELICIOUS.  If you like Chinese sponge cake, you can get that same texture and consistency here in its cakes.  I seriously would have my wedding cake done here.  The frosting isn't heavy (light as air) and I feel like the cake is soft like a pillow.  MmmMmMMm....

Cash only!  Call in if you're going to order by the dozen.
author: Sunny S.

description:
I have been coming here for about 25yrs. My mom use to bring me here when I was a kid, most of my fav. cakes & rolls come from here. The only thing I did not like about them recently (as in 2 days ago when I went to order a cake for my gf's baby shower) is that they would not let my friend taste the cake without any purchase and I mean we were spending a bit of $ for a cake, and I have NEVER encountered a place that would not let you sample something you were about to shell out tons of $ on.

Another downside - CASH ONLY!
author: Bella B.

description:
It's been years since I ate a cake from Sunset.  Since they're recently changed owners and Victor's was on vacation, we got a lemon cake from them.

Cake was a little bit soft.  I prefer my cakes to be firmer.  The whip cream icing was also a bit sweeter than usual.

Cake was fresh so I'd give them that.  They didn't serve us stale cake!
author: Wendy H.

description:
I grew up getting the strawberry sponge cake here and it is consistently DELICIOUS! Get a slice for $1.50, but who can really each just one piece? 

The cake is so light, the frosting is whipped cream with just the right amount of sweetness and the strawberries are always fresh! 

I ordered a 1/2 sheet and a mini round cake for my toddler's first birthday. They were able to take my order and have it ready with less than 2 days notice and it was sooo yummy! LOVE this place!!
author: Hanster P.

description:
One of my all time favorite cake is the Chinese Fruit Cake, and they make it super delicious here. Its fluffy, light, and has the right amount of sweetness. I also love the frosting, not too sweet and not too rich. 

This perfect blend of cake, fruits, and frosting is the ideal for birthdays and celebrations.
author: Denise W.

description:
Best Fruits Cake, Chinese.

It's probably a legacy of my family's tastes, but chinese bakery sponge cakes with not-too-sweet cream and strawberries in the middle are my absolute favorite birthday cake. I mean, everyone's birthday, not just mine. If  I'm tasked with getting the cake, Sunset is where I go. Where I send my cake-buyers. Just go. It's classic, the lovely light and lightly sweet frosting, fluffy cake, and strawberries. 

$16 for a 6-8 inch cake, and $1 for candles. Great deal. I probably ate half the cake on my own. And no, I don't regret it. AT ALL.
author: Jade L.

description:
This review is based on their buns only. 

By far the best BBQ pork buns / Siopio's that I've tried. Other fave's include their hot-dog and cocktail buns. They're super cheap but huge and generous on the fillings. Plus, their always fresh and warm which makes it really difficult NOT to have one right away. Every time we're in the sunset district, we always try and pick some up. 

The only thing is, it gets pretty crowded and parking is a b*$#@!!! You def need to go early and with someone so you can just run out and have them wait in the car or circle a few times.
author: Resa N.

description: Strawberry cake was delicious. Wish I could have a slice right now.
author: Mary M.

description:
definitely unflashy (even with the great reviews their yelp sticker isn't on display) storefront filled with older asians hanging out and sipping tea. great selection of traditional chinese pastries that are fresh and crazily inexpensive. my favorite is the sponge cake (80 cents for light, moist, slightly sweet delight) but other faves include the pineapple cakes (named for the crunchy and sweet top that resembles a pineapple) and strawberry creme cake. i also love sampling the piping hot savory delights in the back rack (all around a dollar or less - a perfect breakfast treat or tasty snack) and pairing it with golden gate soy milk... reminds me of childhood. this is also the spot that i always go to whenever i visit old co-workers since i can get a huge box full of a variety of pastries to snack on.

of note while the chicken bun breading is uber chewy and delicious, the filling is more creamy and gravy-like than how other places make it - probably a plus for some but i'm more partial to drier, saltier fillings. also, while parking is sometimes a little challenging it's doable if you're diligent and this spot is absolutely N-judah-convenient.
author: Jasmine W.

description: The best green onion twists EVER. It is always fresh, soft, moist and just with the right amount of green onion and sweetness. I worship this place!
author: Yao Z.

description:
Somewherrrrrreeeeeeee over the rainbow...there's a Chinese bakery in the Sunset District that's just amazing: Sunset Bakery.

This was the bakery we turned to for all of our birthday cakes (mines and my sisters'). I'd say 90% of my birthday cakes have come from here. We live clear across town, but my parents would make sure to order it by phone and drive alllll the way to 9th Judah to pick it up on that special day. 

Why? Why not save gas? Why not hit up a local neighborhood bakery?

Because. Because.

You know what? A because should suffice. Take it or leave it. 

No, no. I'm kidding. This place is a lot better than the local neighborhood bakeries for several reasons: their cakes are light and airy, not overly-sweet, and their flavors are fantastic. The coffee cake is very popular with us -- well, with me at least, I don't know about my sisters. My parents always made sure that was the cake for my birthday.
author: Betty T.

description: Most delicious cake I've ever had. Exactly what I wanted! And a huge cake that could EASILY feed 8 people was so cheap! If I ever want to buy a cake, I'm coming here. :)
author: Kate B.

description: Great BBQ Pork buns at $1/each and more-legit-than-usual pork with no red food coloring to speak of.  Tried a Pineapple bun too, but I cannot at all agree with the raves...average dough and very dry, crumbly topping.  Though the place looks more or less like a dump, the ladies are nice and I'm sure their cakes and desserts are very good.
author: Eric F.

description:
Every time when I want to go there is because I was craving for their great custard pie! Wasn't taste like those American bakery that with a lot of whip-cream mix with the custard favor which make it taste very heavy and sweet and thick!
Custard pie in sunset bakery is just like those Chinese small custard tart! But the pie which is like x8 bigger then the tart!
But I really love it~ but the problem why I am like disappointing is because since I was there I also like to get a boxes of bread! My first time there I didn't have enough cash so I calculate how many bread and pie can I get before I order~ and ending up the total that I calculate is like couple dollars different~ but I calculated! O_o
So I question the woman! And she look angry! Because she is just calculate everything in her mind but not with the register! (well! If she don't want to use the register to calculate fine! But she have to study better in math) after I question her she start to recalculate everything with that register machine and she notice that she is really wrong but~ she just giving me hard time!
And... after 2 weeks I go back again and same happen to the other woman. So when you go there not just getting one or two bread. Please calculate yourself or else they will just charge you more!
author: Joyce W.

description:
Best Cakes. 
I've been going here my whole life, since I was a child (now I'm 22).  They basically know my mom.  She would get cakes from here for my birthday, three other sisters birthday, and whoever else.  All I had here were cakes.  Great fruit and mocha cakes.  Oh! and might I add the best CUSTARD PIE!!! If your into fluffy flavorful cakes with light sweet frosting this is the place to go.  If I were to recommend a cake it would be the mocha (that's all I want on my birthday) XD
If your skeptical I say try it, not your ordinary Safeway or American styled heavy cakes.
author: michelle m.

description:
Ordered a 2-tier wedding cake with fresh strawberries for 60 people.  

Best wedding cake I've had, and decent wedding cake is hard to come by. You can spend a lot more and the quality won't be as good. Price was excellent. Service was just fine.
author: Laurel B.

description:
Didn't want to waste a good parking spot after my stop at Arizmendi.  The kids really like Chinese cocktail buns, especially when they're freshly baked, so I took a little stroll up the hill.

This place has a steady stream of customers, but it's never crowded and the wait isn't long.  For less than $4, I bought 6 cocktail buns, which they packed in a box and tied it.

Their cocktail buns are pretty good sized.  They have a nice baked glaze on top, and the bread is subtly sweet and soft like Portuguese sweet bread.  Inside is filled with a butter/sugar/coconut filling.  Couldn't wait to eat them at home, so I untied the box, and ate one of the buns.  Very soft, and the filling was still warm.

Only wish I had something hot like coffee or tea.
author: Steve L.

description:
I've tried coming here about four times before and they never have pineapple buns! Granted, it's usually later in the afternoon on a Saturday, I guess I shouldn't be surprised. Anyway, today I was really excited cos I finally got to try some!

I was surprised cos their bo lo baos are not yellow as I'd normally expect, but more light brown. And the bread is a lot thicker.. Anyhow, these are definitely pretty good, I can see why they get sold out! Nice crunch and sweetness and fluffy! Mmm. Also, 60 cents/pc. Yum :)
author: Clarissa L.

description:
This place is a must visit for "asian" desserts. The mixed fruit sponge cake with butercream frosting is a must have for me, especially for my birthday. Its like a cheaper alternative to Sheng Kee that is just as good. The cakes are very well made and can be ordered in as little as a day or two in advance for the larger sizes. The fruit tarts are also just as good, with a not too sweet and not too thick custard. The pie crusts are nothing all that special but it is still a combination that works well.

Aside from these two desserts, they do have a lot of other breads, cakes, pies, and pastries that are worth giving a try.

The baked BBQ Pork Bun is a must have if you are hungry and not craving something sweet. They are as good as they get, with a soft a slight sweet bun and a healthy amount of pork filling.
author: James T.

description: This is truly one of my favorite Chinese bakeries around. It's my spot for family bday cakes, coworker bday cakes, cakes for parties, pastries for me, the works! Which is why we decided to go to this bakery for our wedding cake. We ordered the three tier and it was perfect for our wedding of 200 guests. We agreed on the strawberries and cream filling over white cake. It was fresh, fluffy, light and just perfect. The price was very reasonable too compared to alot of the bakeries in SF. We were very pleased and will once again come back to Sunset bakery for future purchases.
author: Chau H.

description:
I've been to better Chinese bakeries, but it's nice having one close to where I live. 

This was where my family would always get our usual, fruit filled, white cream birthday cakes. We would get a few apple turnovers and egg custard tarts too. 

It's a tiny shop, but they have the usual Chinese pastries such as the cha sui bao (pork bun), bo lo bao (pineapple bun), gai mei bao (coconut bun), etc. I never get tired of these. 

Typing those out is making me hungry. A sweet, crumbly, yet soft pineapple would hit the spot right now. Then wash it down with a tall class of cold milk. MMM...

I suggest trying one of their cakes. It's pretty tasty and cheap!
author: robin w.

description: Not usually a fan of Asian cakes, but they make a pretty darn good Mocha cake!
author: Victor T.

description: My mom had to do all the cake preparations because I was in another state, and Sunset Bakery was awesome and patient as could be. They are insanely affordable and the white cake with strawberries was super moist and delicious. We barely had any cake left! They did a great job.
author: Angelina S.

description: My family and I have been coming here for years. We come for the baked pork buns and mocha cake. The prices have gone up quite a bit over the years, but it's still just as good as when I was a kid. On occasion I come by to pick up breakfast, ham and egg bun and a sponge cake. Everything is very fresh here and the two ladies behind the counter are as nice as can be.
author: Adelina W.

description:
Ever since I moved away from the area as a child, I've always dreamed of finding a good alternative to Sunset Bakery. Twenty years later, I never did find anything remotely close to it.

Nothing was ever as fresh, soft, moist, tasty, nor as cost effective as Sunset Bakery! It makes me gag when I visit another bakery for twice the price and get a flavorless rock instead.

Their food has always been the benchmark to which everything else I've eaten is compared to when it comes to fresh chinese baked goods.

P.S. Try the cocktail buns! There's a reason why they sell out!
author: Anthony L.

description: my family has been going here ever since i was a kid.. this is the perfect place to pick up a birthday cake. in fact my cousins get their wedding cake here as well. their cakes are super yummy and ti's fresh. every christmas and thankgiving we pick up the dessert from here.. my fav is there kumquit pie! it has custard on the buttom. the fruits they used are fresh.  you must try their pies!
author: Belinda C.

description:
A slice of  their strawberry shortcake and a cup of Earl Grey tea....heavenly.

I was drawn here since fellow Yelpers deemed the strawberry shortcake a Sunset Bakery specialty.
After tasting it, I would have to agree. 

Here's why:

Cake: light and moist.

Frosting and cream:  light but smooth as well. 

Strawberries: you get just enough with every bite. Subtle sweetness. 
You can truly enjoy the "natural fruit flavors"  - side note - strange to write when referring to actual fruit -
 
Even she would love it: 
http://www.boostjuicebars.com/images/content/L_3B_015-shortcake.jpg
author: Stella B.

description:
Your definition of a REAL Chinese bakery!!!  I LOOOOOVVEEE this bakery because 
1) it's a family owned bakery (I think)
2) it's really authentic 
3) Their pineapple buns and pork buns are sooooo yummmmmy
4) It's soooo cheap!!!  Pineapple buns = $0.60, Pork Buns $1 now (I think)
5) They have mini fruit tarts that are realllly tasty! not too sweet, the custard is just perfect
6) That's where all the chinese eldery go to hang out in the mornings... so you know it's gotta be good!
author: Diane L.

description: Sunset Bakery sells the best strawberry sponge cake for the money! This is my go to place whenever I'm craving for a 'not too sweet' cake. Very cheap but the combination of the soft sponge cake, fresh strawberries and whip cream is so heavenly! Soooo good!
author: Marina G.

description:
After reading all the reviews I decided to get my sister's mixed fruit bday cake here.  Hmmm ...what to say what to say. It was only okay.  I liked the fluffiness of the sponge cake, which is different from a lot of other bakeries where we have had sponge cake.

I  wasn't too impressed though with the design or the overall quality of the cake where it makes me come back for more. Here are a couple comments made by my picky-a** family. "It's too sweet" (by mommy), or it sucks A** (by brother).    On to the next Chinese bakery I guess.
author: eeerleni d.

description:
With no time to bake a cheesecake for a birthday cake, I quickly hit the interwebs (I mean, Yelp! There are other websites other than Yelp?!) to find a bakery in SF. 

Well, Yelp did not let me down and I decided to try Sunset Bakery. 

Since the intended giftee didn't like sweet cakes, this Chinese bakery was the PERFECT choice. 

Parking was a pain but hey, I'm in SF. Parking's always a pain. Luckily, we found a spot and quickly made our way to the bakery. 

Service was super quick. The lady helping me was attentive and knowledgeable. I picked up a small, white, round cake with mixed fruit with the usual "Happy Birthday!" piped on top. 

The recipient was pleasantly surprised and absolutely loved the cake. It wasn't too sweet and there wasn't a lot of icing that many American bakeries love putting on. The icing itself had enough sweetness to compliment the cake and the fruit was fresh and delicious. 

All in all, it was well worth the $16. I totally need another cake from here. Gotta satisfy my non-existent sweet tooth.
author: Julia W.

description: My favorite is the home maid fresh bagels I love these and my co workers love these One coworker stop at Starbucks and I stop at Sunset Bakery. We enjoy a per fit morning before we start or day.
author: Teresa B.

description:
Got a strawberry cake here today and it was delicious! My coworker has always talked about how great it is here, and really is! Nothing fancy about this bakery tho..it looks just like a typical chinese bakery. 

The cake here is really fresh. I think the strawberry cake is what they are actually known for. We went in today, and asked them if they had any fresh cakes made because we hadn't ordered one in advanced. And they did! They were really friendly and quick about putting the writing on and boxing it up quickly too. The cake was perfect - so fluffy and light and not too sweet at all. It's a whipped cream frosting and not the heavy butter cream and its filled with fresh sweet strawberries. 

Parking here is pretty bad though. I feel sorry for the house that's next to this place, because there is a constant flow of people just quickly parking there so they can run into the bakery to get a cake. I should know, I sat in the other driveway I blocked so we can pick up our cake! This place is also cash only - we actually had to make a run to the ATM (which is only a block away) so we could pay for the cake. Prices here are very reasonable - $16 for the 8 inch, or $18 for 9 inch for the strawberry cake. I def, will be coming here to get my Chinese cakes from now on. Next time I hope to try some of their baked goods and other pastries.
author: Betty S.

description: I LOVE the custard pie here! It's eggy and delicious! It's like a giant dan-tat from dim sum and I think better than the ever so popular Golden Gate Bakery's dan-tat. The pie is only $7.99 and is worth every penny. Sometimes they run out, so you might have to wait up to 20 minutes for a fresh one if they don't have any in the case. I would definitely wait any day for it! YUM!
author: Rachelle T.

description:
Cheap, mom and pop hole in the wall chinese bakery.  Usually can't go wrong, and this place was no exception.  Usually frequent Victor's Bakery on Taraval, but this place was recommended and didn't disappoint.

Got the Black Bean bun to mix it up from my usual order of pineapple and bbq pork buns.  It was great, the filling the right level of sweet without being overwhelming.  The bread was nice, but would have been better warm out of the oven.  There was a sweet crust on top, a little less sweet then usual, but nonetheless worked well with the filling.
author: Sam H.

description:
I've been here maybe a few hundred times, in other words, I've been frequenting this place my whole life. Every time a birthday rolls along in my family, we go to sunset bakery and pick up either a fruit cake or a mocha coffee cake. Without fail, the cake is always super moist, not too sweet, and the freshest fruits are always used to top the cakes. Perfection every time. You should probably order the cake a day in advance to be safe, but 80% of the time, they will have some that were made sometime during the day.

Aside from the cakes, the chinese buns/ breads are also super soft and fresh. I always get the pineapple bun, the ham and corn, and the coconut bun- chidlhood favorites.
author: Carmen L.

description:
This place takes the cake for THE WORST APPLE PIE IN THE HISTORY OF APPLE PIES.  You know how when you cut into a fruit pie the filling should sort of flow out, this one stayed jellified.  It wasn't even refridgerated!  Granted, it was out in a fairly cold kitchen, but even when it was nuked, it maintained its shape.  Scary.  The apples were not crisp at all, more like mush and the sauce felt more like a thick syrupy jam than anything else.  Tried one warm and at room temperature.  Its over spiced and absolutely 100% nasty.  The texture of the crust is the same texture as the filling, flat, soft and cake like.   Did I mention?  The worst apple pie in the history of apple pies.

Also had a BBQ Pork Bun.  Nothing to write home about.  Would rather go to Cafe Bakery on Noriega.
author: Jonathan W.

description:
My mom use to take me and my sister here when we were younger. She use to get us baked char siu buns, egg tarts, cocktail buns...all the good stuff! Very affordable and most importantly delicious!

Today we bought a sheet cake for my bf's moms bday! Strawberries and cream!

Great place to get bday cakes. The fruit comes inside the cake as well as on top, along with the light fluffy sponge cake. Mmmmm so good!
author: Michelle Y.

description: Their showcases look wonderful. I had a slice of coffee mousse cake, and it was okay. Not very moist, but okay. Definitely had caffeine in it, I felt it hit a while after.
author: Emily H.

description: We ordered a cake from Sunset Bakery for our wedding this past weekend and the cake was delicious! My family has been coming here for years and have always had our birthday cakes made here so I knew I could count on them for their amazing cakes! Service is great and prices are very reasonable.
author: A Y.

description: I love the strawberry sponge cake! For less than $20, you can get a delicious, personalized cake (approx 10 slices). The sponge cake is light and fluffy, the decorative frosting has just a hint of citrus, and the strawberries are fresh.
author: Sophie L.

description:
I consider this my private go-to bakery for every family birthday cake.  They are frosted with fresh whipped cream, and you can select fresh fruit -- I usually choose strawberry and kiwi.  They'll customize the top with whatever you want to say.  Hint: when you place your order, write it down exactly as you'd like it laid out.  

The other pastries are always tempting me.  Prices make this a no-brainer.  

You know how after eating out, you're often so full you can't even consider dessert?  Well these cakes are the best choice for those occasions -- they are so light and even if you have a big slice, you won't feel overstuffed!
author: Hannah Lee H.

description:
My sister got a cake from this famed "Sunset Bakery" and it was delicious--definitely warranting a review on yelp. Very fluffy but still firm and light filling, fresh chinese cake, drooool. It was beautifully decorated too.  

Upon seeing the picture of the storefront, I realize--I've been to this bakery countless times during highschool (pre-yelp period). They have lots of other goodies as well, slices of cake, asian pastries like dan-tat, cocktail bun, pineapple etc. 

Always fresh and they have fast service. 

I love the convienence of this place (which is probably why I went to this bakery the most during hs and even college) its like at the intersection of all these bus lines: 43, 44, N-Judah! Nice little bakery.
author: Amy S.

description:
If you're waiting for the N Judah/6/43/66/44 in the mornings, COME HERE.
If you only have a dollar in your pocket, COME HERE.
If you like tasty pastries, COME HERE.

Srsly. I came here for the first time this morning cause I had always wondered what treasures this place holds. And omg ya'll, I spent 1.45 on 2 pastries, which, were like the best tasting pastires ever (for the price)

This place is like that dorky girl from high school with an amazing personality that you will learn to love. Hmmm, basically what I'm trying to say is... that although this places looks like an absolute dive from the outside, the snacks inside are amazing and won't let you down.

See you in the morning.
author: Richard T.

description:
I got my 4-tier wedding cake here for $300. It was beautiful and easily looked and tasted like it cost 3 times as much. 

We got te strawberry sponge cake and it had a lightly sweet taste and nice fluffy icing. 

I ended up bringing in some ribbon that they added to each tier at no extra cost. They also deliverd the cake for free on time on a Saturday afternoon!
author: Adrienne P.

description:
The cake is excellent.  I buy all my family's birthday cake from Sunset Bakery.  The cake is always moist and cream has just the right sweetness.  It's not a fancy cake and, frankly, looks kind of boring.  But it's so good.  

The onion bum is the best in Bay Area.  It runs out quick if you get there late morning.  

I will have to say the parking is a pain.  That's the only bad part.
author: junk m.

description:
I love my YELP!

I checked the reviews for a bakery near Shabu House and my eyes latched on to "strawberry cake" - yes!  I still remember when I was a kid, my aunt made me a strawberry-banana cake with whipped cream, and it was sooo good!  I couldn't wait to try the cake here.

The cake was soft and moist, with a little hint of lemon.  The strawberries inside the cake were sweet.  The strawberries on top of the cake weren't fully ripe, but that's ok.  Everyone seemed to enjoy my birthday cake.  A quarter sheet was $29, almost everyone had a slice, and I still have 1/3 of it left over.

I would give the cake 4 stars, but I'm bumping it up to 5 because I was late in picking it up (they close at 6pm), but they still opened the door for me at quarter after.  Yay for great customer service!
author: Lynnie P.

description:
They did my wedding cake and it was fantastic!!! Twice the cake at 1/3 the price of my second choice. The only bad thing is they use cream (instead of fondant) so the design of the cake is limited.

Very friendly service (ask for Connie). Their custard filling was soooo good....been back for birthday cakes, graduation cakes, and "just because I want cake" cakes =)
author: Chowmein P.

description:
mmm. 
just mmmmm.

came here just yesterday, a half hour before they closed and the buns were still hot and the sweets were still delicious. everything dirt cheap, too. here's the breakdown:

-white icing and sprinkles cupcake-- big, though not the most thrilling cupcake i've ever had. it's more like a cupcake-shaped donut. but for 70 cents, hey!

-hot dog bun-- excellent!! the pastry dough was cooked perfectly, had great flavor, slightly sweet and savory. actually lends itself well to reheating in microwave!

-bbq pork bun-- ^see above, SUPER DELICIOUS!! the char siu inside was not all fatty and grossly gooey (COUGH COUGH SHENG KEE), it was actually very good and thoroughly contained by the thick, delicious outer pastry.

-fruit tart-- OMG. so good. i kept it in the fridge overnight and eating it made me remember to give this review. delightfully flaky (not crunchy) crust filled generously with sweet, sweet custard and a topped with mandarin oranges, kiwi, and strawberry slices.

in total, about $4.00. soooo coming back.
author: Katie M.

description:
I ordered my wedding cake here for November all the way back in May. Since May, I have been back multiple times to Sunset Bakery to change my order, confirm my order, add an order and to drop off ribbon to decorate the cake with. Each time, the ladies have been extremely nice, patient and accommodating. Each time, I also get a cha siu bow (bbq pork bun) to go because they are so tasty here.

They delivered my 5-tier wedding cake and a full sheet cake all the way to Emeryville (for a minimal fee). The cake looked as amazing as it tasted! 

My business with Sunset Bakery went smoothly the entire way! Now I always recommend Sunset Bakery's wedding cakes to my engaged friends! 

Summary: GET YOUR WEDDING CAKE HERE. And their cha siu bows.
author: Sel W.

description:
My favorite Chinese bakery, hands down!

My family has been coming here for years.

My favorite: freshly baked pineapple buns. Perfectly crispy topping & soft bread.

I also really love their cakes, cocktail buns, pork buns, and pretty much everything else they sell.

I wish I could have some right now..
author: Michelle P.
