description: Me and my friends ALWAYS get our birthday cakes from Sunset bakery. It is now a tradition that we made. The cakes are "Chinese cakes" (sponge like).. fruits and yummy! The prices are reasonable and they always have our cake ready to go.
author: Tiff C.

description:
Without doubt, the best custard pie in the city.  Back in the day, there was this old school restaurant called Sum Wai Que on Jackson St in Chinatown.  They had the best custard pie, but they're long gone now.  Years later we found out about this place and we've been going there ordering the custard pies all the time.  If you never had it before, it's like a giant dan tat!  It's pretty dam good!
They also have other stuff that I tried and liked a lot, strawberry custard pie, strawberry cake, the pineapple buns.  All worth going there again and again.
author: Peter L.

description: Everything I've tried is really good, especially the pineapple bun and BBQ pork bun. The chicken bun is unique from other Chinese bakeries and you should try...someone described the filling as like Chicken pot pie. I usually also get custard tart (not the best but good), egg custard pie (yum!), and cocktail bun. Cocktail bun has sesame in it...but can't taste it.
author: Katharine P.

description:
I've been away from SF for close to two years now, but I still think nostalgically and fondly of Sunset Bakery. I think the difference between this place and the local bakeries is that a lot of their buns are kept in the oven so when it comes out, it's nice and warm. And it's so cheap too!

Recommended!
author: Garett N.

description: The cakes here are a family favorite. Any occasion or special event, we come here for the cake and cookies.
author: Marcus J.

description:
My feeling on Sunset Bakery are based on the one item I've had, the two times I've had it, and the ease of each transaction.

I was in charge of office birthday celebrations (read: I had to get cake) for a bit while my boss was on vacation. Two co-workers in a row requested a cake without super-sweet, heavy frosting and with fresh fruit. I turned to Yelp to help me out, and everyone was right - the white cake with whipped cream frosting and fresh strawberries is GOOD.

While I have an healthy sweet tooth, I don't like the typical, grocery-store-cake frosting, so this was a great change. The cake was moist, the frosting was just sweet enough, and the berries were fresh and tasty.

Both transactions were super easy and the cakes are inexpensive. $18 for a 9" inch cake that fed 15-16 people ain't bad. Cash only though, beware. I didn't have any trouble relaying my desired writing for the top either. I'd definitely like to go back sometime and try some other stuff!
author: Carmen B.

description:
This place makes me both really happy and sad at the same time.

The egg tarts are the beacon that brings me here, but, also my source of sorrow:
Egg tarts original name was pastel de nata or pastel de belém. It was created in early 19th century by nuns in Portugal (not a lot of people had access to eggs and sugar like nuns did back then-hence the term conventual cooking, an elaborate cooking "genre" filled with goodies.
Upon the liberation revolution the monastery where the egg tarts were made was closed, and the recipe was bought by a merchant that soon turn them into a local success. The years went by, many versions of the recipe were created, and the tarts popularity became undeniable. The Portuguese connection with Macau and china made the recipe "swim"all the way over to the other side of the world, becoming pretty popular over there too. 
The Guardian considered pasteis de nata de 15th most delicious stuff to eat (I don't remember the exact name of the category), and still, every time I sink my teeth in them at the sunset bakery to have a taste of home I struggle understanding why don't they have the full recipe. The chinese version is more puddingy, not as creamy and silky as the Portuguese version, you don't quite feel the lemon and the cinnamon (that should be infused in the milk before the milk is mixed with the eggs) and they don't caramelize the top of the tart (as it is traditionally done) or sprinkle it with cinnamon (the finishing of a lot of conventual desserts) .

Despite the incomplete tart I still love this place and go there often :)
author: Bea L.

description: I followed Yelp's advice on ordering their strawberry cake to go for an event the following day.  It was delicious - I was amazed by how light and flavorful it was.  This review is entirely superfluous as dozens of people have said the same thing, but I wanted to add my voice to the chorus.
author: B L.

description:
the strawberry cakes are the best here.  I always pick one up for bday parties...my best friend loves them here and that's my gift to her each year...and compared to other cakes, they are cheap for light and fluffy cake, light frosting and sweet strawberries...can't beat that.
I've had some of the other baos here but the strawberry cakes is what keeps me coming back...
author: Christina L.

description:
Chinese Cake!  Well... this is more like the last resort when it's someone's birthday in the family and we need a cake.  It's pretty much the local Chinese bakery for my house so I'll head on over here in the morning if I need to pick up Pork Buns and Egg Custards to feed a group of people for breakfast.  This place is pretty standard.  I haven't come across anything wrong with it or getting stale food.

Oh yeah, having Cold Vitasoy is always a plus.
author: Chris C.

description:
Went to my favorite bakery today, been coming here for years and the quality is always top notch.they do cakes and wedding cakes, almost all
of the Chinese specialty and my favorite the "horn" . a pastries with a creamy frosting in the middle. ====WARNING=== parking is not easy you will get one if you willing to walk a block or so. prices are cheap/reasonable.
author: Howard J.

description:
One of my FAVORITE Chinese Bakeries! Not only is this place within close proximity to where I live, but their food is just delicious! I've been coming here since I was little for birthday cakes and let me tell you, they make THE BEST Chinese cakes!! You can place an order for your cake in the morning and have it ready for pick up by the end of the day! How awesome is that?

Another one of my favorites from here are the onion buns! It's probably about six inches long and has green onions (of course), ham, and is buttered. I have not had better! 

I can't wait to go home and get myself an onion bun!
author: Eugenia G.

description:
Usually Strawberry cake here is off the chain.  Strawberries are sweet, frosting is light, creamy, and sweet (but not too sweet), and cake is moist and light.  I usually hate cake, but get fat on this one.  They sell it by the slice if you don't want to eat the whole thing.

Their gai mei bao (Cocktail bun) is good, as is the baw law bao (pineapple bun), as already stated.  Never had a daan tat here cause' I am too busy eating cake.
author: Kapeli M.

description:
One of my family friends bought some CREAM PUFFS here that taste almost exactly like the overly priced ones at Beard Papas on Mission St that so many people love....but I hate cus of the price prob for the nice packaging and hype.  But the cream puffs here are CHEAPER so I'm going to go here much more often for these.  

At first, I thought it was mainly an Asian cake bakery that I barely tried but I'll be going more often for the puffs.

I havent tried a cake from here yet, only from their competitor across the st (J&J Bakery) so I cant comment on those.
author: Gilbert C.

description: I remember stopping here for a bun when I was a kid and haven't been back for almost 20 years.  I forgot how good their cocktail bun is.  Loved it!!!  Bun was soft and the filling was not greasy like most other bakeries.
author: Irene C.

description:
Some observations: 
1. I purchased a poppy-seed muffin for 50 cents.  
2.  It was good.
3. The usuals were hanging out reading their Chinese newspapers, gossiping, and helping themselves to coffee.  
4.  A nice community feel.  Not young or hip.  Very different from the Arizmendi bakery crowd.  
4. It's less than two blocks from 9th & Irving.
5. 50 cents for a muffin in the Starbucks age!  
6.  Right across the street from the 44, 6, 43 bus stop and N line.  
Check it out next time before you get on the bus.
author: Branden T.

description: Delicious desserts for a great price. The best cream puffs I've ever had! You must give it a try! Also they have mana pua (or pork buns) which are also tasty!
author: gretchen p.

description: The pork buns at this place are big and hearty chock full of deliciousness. I also tried their strawberry cake which was very fluffy and sweet. The strawberries were well picked and tasted fresh. I still maintain pie is better than cake. Hail pie!
author: Jose U.

description:
I love this place....
My friend Kat told me about if when i was shopping for wedding cakes .  I got a beautiful 4 tier wedding cake for $300 it was simple but so very yummy.  I also love the taste of their  strawberry sponge cake.  And now that i have my daughter I will be buying all of her birthday cakes from here.  A whole sheet cake is only cost me $83 bucks.... its so worth it.  The only bad part is the parking.
author: Sheenie L.

description:
A great bakery to get cake - especially the strawberry cake. The cake is fluffy and spongey, and the frosting tastes like lightly sweetened fresh snow. So delicious and light that I had to help myself to a second serving at my friend's birthday gathering tonight. 

However, I still wouldn't say that it's the fluffiest or spongiest I've ever had. Aki's, I feel, still has the best cakes overall.
author: Christine K.

description:
hard to park around here.

i've always loved this place.  the price is decent and i get the pork buns and the chicken buns.  also, LOVE the chicken pie they make for a dollar.

i've also ordered my cakes here on more than one occasion for birthdays to any reason.  I've always gotten either the mandarin orange or the strawberry cake.  what can they do to mess it up?  so far nothing...i assume the worst would be they forget the date but so far...so good.
author: Bing D.

description: Tried a 2nd time, bought the same whole round strawberry cake w/ strawberries on top for a family occasion.  This time it was much better.  Strawberries were fresh, could have used more berries on the inside though.  Everyone ate it up and a nephew wanted to eat up all the leftover whipped cream off the cake bottom cardboard.  $20 for 12 good sized servings.
author: Foodsy C.

description: My favorite cake is a Chinese fruity chiffon cake with whipped cream-- you know, the kind with peaches, strawberries, and kiwis in it.  I ordered one from this bakery 5 years ago for my wedding, and not only was it cheap ($300 for a cake serving 250), it was delicious and everyone raved about it.  The decorating itself wasn't so great, but I had my florist embellish the cake with flowers.  I think this place has the best chinese chiffon cakes ever!
author: Jen C.

description: I love Sunset Bakery!!! Love all their breads, cookies & cakes. They r so cheap & yummy!!! Customer service is awesome. Way better than Golden Gate or any other bakery in Chinatown!!!
author: Baby C.

description: I like this bakery! It's pretty close to my house, so I always come here. The cupcakes are pretty worth it (very good prices!) and their pretty good. The ladies that work there are very nice as well. Love this bakery.
author: Cara H.

description: I've had ten or more versions of an ONION BUN, or ham & green onion bun, from various chinese (ot otherwise) bakeries, and Sunset Bakery has been the best.  Wether it's puffy fresh melt in your mouth warm from the oven (forget your 'nouvelle maple/bacon/donuts'), or next day dense and bread-y, able to serve as a hot dog wrap, soup soaker, or a lunch bun, they are delightful.  When I bring a dozen to my work site we cut each into thirds with scissors and ten people feast or snack or accompany their tea or coffee with them all day.  I always bring along some breath-freshening gum.
author: Stan M.

description: I LOVE SUNSET BAKERY. Their BBQ pork buns are incredible! And so cheap! Is any other reason necessary??? It's pretty tucked away and easy to pass by but you definitely want to stop by and try one. As a poor student with a mountain of loans, I was too tired to cook and too poor to afford real groceries so I ended up getting two regular sized buns for dinner one night. Let's just say I ended up having lunch all squared away for the next day.
author: Tiffany C.

description: Am I expecting too much? Why is this place rated so high? I mean, don't get me wrong.. the mocha birthday cake I ordered today tasted good. We had a cake from Sheng Kee to go along with it, and I liked the flavor of this one better. I was afraid that the cake would've been made too simple, but it was nicely decorated for a simple cake. Although the batter of the Sheng Kee cake was much smoother. I've been here before, and its a small little shop. I wouldn't have ordered from here if I hadn't read the yelp reviews. I would come here and order cakes again, for it was a pretty good cake for only $16!
author: Elaine H.

description:
My family's go-to place for cakes as well as mine.

Chinese cakes are the best because they aren't too sweet, they're light and airy and have tons of fruits! 

Can't go wrong with their wide selection of baked goods either! Mini butterfly cookies, yummy! You can also buy small slices of their cakes, too.
author: Christine C.

description:
My family has been going here for as long as I can remember ever going to San Francisco to visit my relatives (practically since I was 3 or something...) We always order boxes of their baked sio pao (bbq pork). Of course, I will always get their pineapple bun for dessert. Sometimes, on rare occasions, we would get their cakes. I love their white fruit cakes! YUM!  Also, we may get their eclairs. YUM!

I would give this place 5 stars, but I was traumatized a long time ago...when I saw cockroaches in their display case...EWWW! GROSS, huh? So every time I go there, I have a habit of continuously scanning their case for little creepy crawlies!
author: Rachel C.

description: I love their BBQ pork buns!  My favorite place to get BBQ  pork buns, pineapple buns, mexican buns and cakes.  The cakes come with fruit and the icing isnt overwhelmingly sweet.  Their pumpkin and custard pie is pretty decent.  The staff is pretty nice.
author: she q.

description: This is one of the best places in San Francisco for Chinese cakes! They're lightly sweeten sponge cakes with such fluffiness! Make sure you pre-order their strawberry and banana cake in advance and you'll be glad you did!
author: Sharon H.

description:
Since the line at Arimendez was SO long, I decided to walk up the street to Sunset Bakery instead. I bought a cocktail bun and a chicken bun. The cocktail bun was delicious! Freshly baked bread filled with sweet coconut filling. I had their pineapple and BBQ pork buns before and they are usually really good too. I tried the chicken bun for the first time and I was quite disappointed (hence the lack of 1 star). Not too much chicken meat and instead it was more "sauce or gravy." Blah!

Overall, their buns are great and so are their Chinese cakes.
author: Denise L.

description:
I LOVE LOVE LOVE the red bean buns....and the BBQ pork buns.....and the sugar crusted buns.....and, well, everything.
Plus, at less than a dollar a bun, you should scoop them up!
author: Jessica L.

description:
We used Sunset Bakery to make our wedding cake..yes a little unexpected, but they did a great job at an amazing price. 

We ordered the white cake with fresh strawberry filling. They decorated the cake for us with ribbon that matched our wedding items and delivered it to our reception location. 

The cake was delicious and I will go back here to have anything in their bakery case!
author: Alisa S.

description:
If you like cocktail buns (squishy soft bread filled with a sweet coconut paste), then you will LOVE Sunset Bakery. In fact, they usually sell out of their cocktail buns by early to mid-afternoon so you'll need to call early to reserve some. 

Their black bean buns are also excellent. Though I'm not sure why they call them black bean since they are clearly using only sweet red beans in them.

It's a small, mom-and-pop sort of shop...sort of messy and unorganized-looking but the aromas wafting all around will lull you into such a stupor that you won't even notice the clutter. 

Also...parking is nonexistent. Unless you're going to walk there, you'll need a friend to drop you off and double-park as you run in to pick up the cocktail buns being reserved under your name. 

Service is warm and friendly.
author: SfMom O.

description: Everything they have in their heater is delicious. Cocktail bun, chicken bun, and ham/corn bun are my favorites!
author: Paul M.

description:
Ok...so, its been awhile since my last review...i've been busy....I know, no excuse, but I had to try to explain myself!

I had to order a last minute birthday cake for a birthday party I was putting together for 2 of my dearest friends and Sunset Bakery came through for me.  I gave them a call at 10 am on a Sunday and placed an order for a 1/4 sheet strawberry and mandarin orange cake.  I asked if they can have the cake ready by 12:30 pm that day with writing on the cake and they said "sure, no problem".  

The cake was fluffy, the fruits were fresh and they don't overdo the cream.  Top that off with great service for an easy 5 star review.
author: Stella C.

description:
I buy all my birthday cakes here.  In my opinion, the fresh cream (not that sickly, yucky, super sweet butter icing crap that every bakery slathers cakes with) and strawberry cake is the best.  AND, you can call them up on the same day and put in an order and they'll have it ready.  

I love it because the cake is not heavy and definitely not too sweet.  Swear to God, just get a 10" and put your fork in it.  They sell by the slice but I am telling you, get the whole bloody cake.

Cash only but don't worry, it's not going to break your bank.  You can get a 10" round (I think that might be the smallest size) for something like $16.
author: Mei B.

description: The bakery I had set my heart on doing my wedding cake stopped doing wedding cakes as of this year. My mom and hubby liked Sunset bakery's cakes and I was happy with the very reasonable price of $200 for up to 200 servings. The girl we talked with originally was great explaining everything and in English so I could understand (hubby does all the Cantonese speaking and I was happy not to have to need translations. Wedding planning is annoying when you have to rely on others to communicate to a vendor and your hubby is a procrastinator). However it seems the girl that hubby talked to 2 weeks prior the wedding to drop off the check did not know what she was doing as well. Also hubby was not happy they waited until wedding day to check if the ribbon was enough so hubby had to buy another roll and drop it off that morning. Hence the 1 star off. But the cake looked good and the taste was yummy - appropriately not too sweet for those older Chinese guests. So overall we were happy with their service.
author: Melanie O.

description:
Their cakes are really awesome! Creams and strawberries are fresh and the cakes themselves are pretty tasty, too!

I highly recommend their cream cakes and their wedding cakes; prices are actually slightly cheaper than average while the quality is really GOOD!. I highly recommend this place, especially for their cakes.
author: Victor K.

description:
Known for their cakes!  Yum!!!
There's strawberry, peach, mocha, chestnut ...(yeah..chestnut)

If you haven't had chestnut cake before...don't be daring and buy a full 8 or 9" cake.  The first time I had it...it was very weird looking to me...  (I won't say what it looked like...just very interesting!)  Tasted great...but didn't look appealing...

...definitely try their strawberry cake.  ...very light...not too sweet...
author: Lise T.

description: I ordered my wedding cake here and everyone loved the cake. It was not too sweet, and it was light and fluffy. Delivered on time as promised and it is more than reasonably priced!
author: Debby W.

description:
I have the worst sense of direction in the world, BUT I remember how to get HERE, even though it's not that close to my house.  That gets 4 stars alone!!! =D
One of my favorite desserts are fruit tarts.  I've tried several places.  
So far, this place is the winner.
Not too sweet, but sweet.  Filling is creamy and smooth.  Fruit are fresh.
I also love their fruit cake... I had it for my birthday for several years in a row!! 

I haven't had a chance to try anything else, I'm stuck on the fruit tarts.
author: Michelle Y.

description:
They probably have the best cakes in town!  This is an Asian bakery so the cakes and baked goods are not as sweet as traditional European bakeries.  They have cakes that are very hard to find like the Water Chestnut cake.  They have excellent chicken pies and their mocha cake is absolutely to die for.

I come here for birthday cakes and they also make a killer chocolate cake that is perfect blend of chocolate and sweetness (not too sweet though).  

It is extremely hard to find parking here so I would suggest grabbing a buddy and sending them in to pick up whatever you need.  If you are ordering a cake, be sure to call in ahead so that they can make your cake.
author: Polarg W.

description: this place is cheap, good, and fast. Cakes are yummy, the pork buns are off the freaking chain..and cheap. Of all the places on the 9th block-this place is the one i'd say go to first. Its straight forward. Many places on 9th are really pretentious. Not this place. Get in, get out, get your eat on.
author: LS L.

description: I got slice of custard cake not really sweet but good.  I feel like eating more to get addicted to it.  Cost a dollar.  I alot of people working here.  I think they have a big kitchen.
author: John F.

description: I could live off of Pineapple buns and this place is the reason why. Even if its not fresh (next day) they still taste better than most places that just made them fresh.
author: Derrick H.

description:
Two words: Pineapple Bun!!

Pineapple bun has neither pineapple or is much like a bun...discuss!

This chinese pastry is warm, sweet and tasty!  And for something like $.50, you can't beat it.  The name comes from the look, of a pineapple...so they say, I don't see it...and i'm sure the chinese name probably has a different meaning.  Call it anything, just give me more!!
author: Sir Paul L.

description: Super Bowl party tip: In the 4th quarter, when everyone has OD'd on nachos and beer and even the commercials have shifted towards pain relievers, there's nothing like busting out with some cake.  I didn't find anything super-fancy or exotic at Sunset Bakery, just great prices, and superb spongy cakes with whipped cream frosting (the only way to go, frosting-wise).  Pay a little extra and you can get a fat layer of chestnuts between the cake and frosting.  Highly recommended.
author: Wes M.

description: The strawberry cake here is freakin awesome.  I bought a whole cake for 10 people, a chicken bun, and a sponge cake.  Everything was less than $20!!!  Unbelievable.  I ate the chicken bun and sponge cake before I set foot outside the door.  I am half way done with the cake.  The chicken bun isn't the normal steamed chicken bun.  Its the baked version.  The chicken filling resembled a chicken pot pie.  It was good.  I am definitely going back to buy me a 20 person cake.
author: Fatty A.

description: Their absolutely delicious baked BBQ pork buns have tamed many hunger pangs in the days of rushing between CCSF and work across town.  The perfectly chewy bun has just the right amount of sweetness in the glaze, and they don't skimp on the filling, which tastes precisely as a BBQ pork bun should.
author: Jenn C.

description: I've had this cake since I can have remembered! I lovee the whipped cream and mixed fruit! Normally, I don't like whipped cream, but i LOVE theirs! It's so sweet and delicious! I'm eating it as I type. My mom would rather me go somewhere else, but I'd rather get this. I can't explain how much I love this cake!
author: Annabelle T.

description:
sunset bakery, i'm so sorry! i've been coming here for years and i am only now writing a review. 

all the reviews are true - cheap and tasty asian cake and pastries. 

it's completely unexpected to walk into a place like this, it looks like it hasn't changed since the early 90s, and it probably hasn't, and get such great food.

i always get my birthday cake here as well as for any of my friends. i usually go with strawberry with regular yellow cake. can't go wrong. the cake is airy and the whipped cream frosting is only a little sweet, so you don't end up with a plate of cream like you do at other places.

one thing to do is to call ahead of time and reserve your cake. they have cakes ready to go in the fridge, and they'll gladly write on them, but when you pre-order, the cake and the fruit are fresh as can be. 

their bao are great too. i scarfed down a pineapple one one time and it was flaky on top and the bun was nice and squishy.
author: Melissa C.

description: Need a birthday/family party/work event cake? Don't need a chi-chi, sculpted chocolate masterpiece, but also don't want to show up with a slab from the supermarket? Go to Sunset Bakery. I picked up a 1/4 sheet white cake with cream-and-strawberries for a 40-something's birthday, and it was a huge hit (for under $30). Cash only, very sweet staff. I went in on a Saturday morning, and the last 1/4 sheet had just been plucked out of the refrigerator before my eyes. The staff asks if I can I come back in two hours? They promise to have a cake ready for me. And they did.
author: Miss M.

description: I wish I could have a pork bun from here every day of my life!
author: Robert H.

description: i think this place is decent and def doesn't deserve the 4.5 average stars. mayb it's be there's no other dim sum bakeries in inner sunset but i'm just not that impressed. the food is cheap, of course. the bbq buns that people raved about was ok. overall, not a huge fan.
author: Joyce B.

description: Bought a strawberry cake for my dear friend's bday.  She loved it.  I liked it.  It's not that sweet.  Which is perfect.  And the cake is soft like .... pound cake maybe.... Perfect texture, perfect sweetness, and perfect decoration.  Price is very very decent.  $16 for a cake that feeds 7-9 people.  The thing I love most about this cake is the amount of cream they use.  I dont like cream and they use just the right amount.  (fyi, I still scrape off the cream and just eat the cake, cream just taste so fattening and greasy, ya feel?)
author: Mimi S.

description: I nursed an entire breakup with their cream puffs, eclairs, fruit tarts, tiny cakes - you name it, I ate it. I did get a little fat but I didn't spend a lot of money. This place is amazing.
author: Neely M.

description:
hot dog bun: yum
ham and corn bun: yum
ham and egg bun: yum
egg tart: yum
author: A L.

description: I love Sunset Bakery for their cocktail buns, pineapple buns, and ham & corn buns. The best! They are huge and it's only $0.60 each. I think ham & corn buns are $0.90 each. They are all kept in the oven so it stays warm. Sometimes when I go there late in the afternoon, the breads are sitting outside though. Not as good when it's cold but still yummy!
author: Jeanie K.

description: Like Hannah Lee H says, this is my "go-to" bakery for cakes.  I've been getting cakes here for years and they're always moist and delicious with lots of fruit, and totally cheap.  The decoration is pretty simple and you should tell them exactly what you want.  They're pretty good about last minute orders as well.  The pastries are also excellent.  I love getting the pineapple buns when picking up an order.  The only things is that parking is an issue, especially when you have to carry a sheet cake up the hill!
author: Em C.

description:
eww. this place is absolutely horrible. the employees there are means and old and plain evil. the people who work in the kitchen are old chinese people or immigrants who smoke at any given chance and touch cake right after. that means that their cigarette ashes are getting all over my cha siu boa, which i must also say is NOT good! the people at the front counter are devils, probably the wives of the unhygienic and insanitary old men in the kitchen. 
first, they do not speak english. I was ordering a cake there once, and the old lady asked what i wanted to write on the cake, and  i said "happy birthday jessica". she then asked me to spell the name and i started spelling slowly and clearly. 
but she, stupid as ever, kept yelling at me, saying she couldn't hear and telling me that my english was bad, when clearly, she was the immigrant from china and did not know english!
i mean, i was born here, and i don't have an accent.
but that fat thing behind the counter kept yelling at me and going biserk!
omg, the worst experience ever. i bet she even spit in my cake. it tasted horrible too!
no one at the party ate it with the exception of like 5 people. 

DO NOT UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES COME TO THIS PLACE!
IT SUCKS!
author: Jamie L.

description: The most luscious Chinese strawberry/fruit sponge cakes you will find in the city, if not the entire region.  Seriously, if it wasn't for the horrid parking,  I'd be there every day....stuffing my face with the compendium of cakes (large and small), egg tarts, fruit tarts, and pork buns on offer.  Good for my pocketbook, but kind of bad for the waistline.
author: Suepattra M.

description: Get the custard pie, it's awesome. Also, the cakes are good if you don't want a heavy, rich, sweet cake. The frosting is perfectly light and airy, great for an after dinner dessert. This bakery will always be close to my heart.
author: Jen Y.

description:
If you want a really fresh, light, spongy, and delicious fruit cake (all strawberry or variety)...Sunset Bakery is the best in San Francisco.  Believe me, as a child, I grew up eating several different types of the so called 'Chinese Cake' or 'Chinese Fruit Cake' and there is no other bakery that makes these type of cakes the way they do.  I'm also someone who typically eats only the cake portion of cakes, disposing of any frosting, fudge, or creme.  That stuff is usually too sweet and heavy.  However, the light whipped frosting that covers the exterior and separates the cake layers is delish!  Very light and not too sweet!  Now, the type of cakes I've been raving about above are only the spongy yellow fruit cakes.  They also sell chocolate cakes which in my opinion are not that good.  Chinese bakeries are not known for making good chocolate cakes.  They are light brown in color with just a hint of chocolate flavor.  Personally, the chocolate cakes at Safeway or Luckys is better.

I've not tasted any of the baked buns or other pasteries as I work close to Chinatown and will walk there to purchase those.

Pros: 
1. Great fruit cakes
2. Friendly staff

Cons: 
1. Parking (I usually have my bf pull into the next door driveway and wait for me while I run in)
2. Does not except credit cards
3. Chocolate cakes
author: A W.

description: Not too sweet but taste good.  Fruit cakes!
author: Tanessa J.

description: I love this place.  Partly because it's incredibly convenient to pop in for a quick breakfast while I'm waiting at the bus stop which is right outside, but mostly because they just have good stuff.  Sunset Bakery is a no frills Chinese bakery with friendly, hard-working owners/employees who whip up some wonderful pastries.  They have tasty egg tarts, some savory buns, flaky turnovers and a variety of cakes.  My favorite, above anything else is the "strawberry slice" cake.  I'm happy to see that it's gotten a lot of Yelp love, and deservedly so.  The cake is soft, light and not too sweet, the icing tastes like real whipped cream, again not too sweet, and the strawberries are fresh, cold and delicious.  Sometimes it's simple pleasures like this that make everything worthwhile.  I'm a regular and a big fan of this place.
author: Alexander J.

description:
I've tried several of the buns here: cocktail, ham & green onion, raisin and pineapple (with and without black bean).  All are very good, except the ham & green onion can be a little bit dry sometimes.  

Their strawberry shortcake is yummy and super cheap.  you can even order one on the morning of the day you need it.
author: Crystal W.

description: This place is the go to bakery for all the corporate events. Excellent service. Reasonable prices. Delicious cakes that are not overbearingly sweet. I love the texture and how light they are. Everybody always asks where I purchase these cakes. I highly recommend trying out this place.
author: Jafar Amir Hanovic Ismailov M.

description: Had my wedding cake made here. Ordered a 4 tier cake. 2 tiers mocha and 2 tiers strawberry. I unfortunately had only one bite of the cake, the night of my wedding. But from what i hear from friends and family it was one of the best Chinese bakery cake they have eaten.  The price was very good even after making some small changes which cost extra. And you get $25 bucks back when you return the cake stands. Only small down fall is the cake only comes frosted with no decorations, so you have to find a cake decorator to add some nice touches to it. But over all very good!
author: Stephanie Y.

description: I was craving a cocktail bun so I went here and got one. The bun was pretty big, only 50 cents, and had a ton of coconut goopy deliciousness inside it. It was warm and fresh. I also had a little coconut macaroon for only 25 cents. I will definitely come here again.
author: O K.

description:
i love their coffee cake! so much so that I bought my own birthday cake here....=)

Great coffee flavor! 
Never tried their other baked goods.  

YUMMMMM!  Will definitely be back for their cakes!
author: LiveToEat F.

description: Loved it.  You will too.  Get a cake.  Seriously.  Today.  Why not?  Get a white cake with mandarin oranges in the middle and strawberries on top.  You will fall in love and from then on, no other cake will be good enough.  I think they put crack in it but I don't really care.  The really amazing thing:  These cakes are frickin cheap, dude.  I got a half sheet which fed 45 people and had left overs for like $40 or something...For a high quality, tastes fresh, IS fresh, light cake with perfect fruit and real whipped cream, you can't do better.  And they are beautiful.  And your friends will think you are a rockstar.
author: A S.

description: I tried a Mocha Cake from here for a birthday. It was a half-sheet and was delicious. The top layer had an assortment of fruits and once sliced, there were three layers of mocha. Would recommend this cake! :) Yum Yum!
author: Wendy T.

description: The gai-mae-baos are a great quick breakfast in the morning waiting for the bus on the way to work. I like the crusts of the custard tarts, but I've had better ones with more flavor in the custard itself.. Had a custard pie taste test recently though, and their custard pie fared pretty well.. This is the go- to place whenever my family wants those not too sweet white cakes with fruit on top.
author: j w.

description: It's a pretty good bakery. Freshly made according to the owner. Price is reasonable. Overall not bad!
author: Mikey D.

description: I visited on the recommendation of a long time customer who said the employees of ucsf are always making the trek to pick up cakes, pastries and other goodies. My favorites are the strawberry cake and the mocha roll. Also, their apple pie is as close to the apple pies of chinatown (but outside of chinatown) I've ever found.
author: chip n. c.

description:
Unbeatable price and amazing taste for their wedding cake.
For 70 peoples at our wedding, my husband and I only spent $180. And everyone loved the taste of the cake.
author: Jessica L.

description: I was craving baked goods and yelp pointed me to this great find...I had the strawberry sponge cake which also didn't steer me wrong.  It was so light and fluffy.  I had been deprived of a good light Chinese cake since my obsession with the likes of souffles, tiramisus, and decadent chocolate cakes...but what a refreshing change to the palate and a very welcoming change to my wallet!  The $2 slices, 60 cent cupcakes, and 70 cent custards really blew my mind!  I had gotten so accustomed to the $10 cake slices and $4 froo froo cupcakes.  Sunset Bakery is far from that in a good way and is a great divey, family run gem.
author: Debbie Y.

description: Best pork bun I have had in this city.  Period.
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description: Best cake ever!  I have tried their cakes at various parties my friends have held and finally had an opportunity to order one for my party. I've tried both the strawberries and mixed fruit cakes but opted for a full sheet of the mixed fruit ($83) because sometimes the strawberries are sweet. A full sheet sounds like a lot but it really isn't enough because this cake is soooooooooo darn GOOD!  The cake is light and fluffy and even when you're full you can eat a whole slice of it. Everyone at my party was asking where I ordered the cake from...can't wait for another party so I can eat some more cake.
author: Sunni F.

description: Wow!  Fantastic birthday cake. Nice place, have been here before. They made the frosting writing very nice.  Only problem is they did not handle the waiting line very well.
author: David G.

description: Best bakery in San Francisco!  The owner is an upstanding guy. I like the pork buns, twisty bread with ham and green onion, and egg tarts.
author: Jeffrey R.

description:
i mostly come here for their custard pies - you can get a whole pie for about 6 bucks i think. the pie and crust is just so fresh. my cousin who lives in japan always picks up a pie at this place first day he lands here. 
the apple pie is just okay. their pork buns are good too.

i also really like their cream puffs - which are filled with real whipping cream and not butter cream like a lot of other chinese bakeries use.
author: Douglas F.

description: Sunset Bakery has one of the best Chinese cakes in the city! I usually come here to buy cakes for my friends birthdays. They also have pastries which are good on the go for a breakfast meal.
author: Edgar G.

description: Their fruit custard tart is amazing! I hear everything else is good too but I get tunnel vision when I visit. And so cheap! So cheap! Sorry, well-priced baked goods make me very excited.
author: Queenie C.

description: Still 4 stars even tho they changed the custard filling for the cake.  Many times we order mixed fruit cake with custard filling here.  Well custard is better than the regular creme right.  Well worth paying a few bucks extra.  And their strawberry creme pies are awesome.  We always get 2 for the holidays.
author: Allison T.

description: I haven't tried their pastry yet, but for the cake part, i will sure give them 5 stars!  Just ordered a half sheet mix fruit cake from them last week for a friend's birthday.  This is not the first time I ordered from them.  I got many good compliments both times about their cakes.   I don't like cake that's too sweet.  I used to be a Tart-To-Tart fan as well.  But i have to say, sunset bakery wins at  both the taste and price.  Good value and great taste. Go try it yourself and see.  you won't regret!
author: Jasmin Y.

description: So, we needed a cake for a friends birthday. It was 5:55pm and they closed at 6pm. I was on the bay bridge, called in the order, told them I was gonna be late, and they were totally cool with it. When I got there at 6:15pm they weren't upset at all, and gave me a great cake with all the writing I wanted.  They were super nice, and did whatever they could to get me a cake.  It also  tasted good as well. 5 stars for such great service, and staying open late just for me.
author: Peter K.

description:
Love their cake!! Very light and not too sweet!

Also, love their BBQ pork bun! yum!

They always have plenty of whole cakes in the back 
and they write message on it for free
Great Service!
author: M I.

description: Pork Buns, Pork Buns, Rolly Polly Pork Bun, Pork Buns, Pork Buns, eatem' up YUM!
author: Bill T.

description: We usually buy their cakes for special occasions here. Imo it's one of the better Asian bakeries in S.F. The ladies behind the counter are very friendly and helpful.
author: Steven J.

description: The cake is really good. Moist, and fresh. The look of the cake isn't the best, but hey as long as it tastes good.. fine with me.
author: Katherine C.

description: This is my favorite chinese style cake place to go to.  Their cakes are moist and spongy and they're not too sweet.  Their cakes are always fresh because their cakes are always in demand.  I even ordered my wedding cake from this place.  If you're looking for the best chinese style bday cake, this is the place to get it.
author: Katniss B.

description: I've never tried their cakes, but I'm a big fan of their hot dog bao and the pineapple buns (no it doesn't have pineapple in it despite the name). Good ratio of bun to dog. As for the pineapple bun, it's soft on the inside but slightly crisp on the outside with just the right hint of sweetness.
author: Jane K.

description: Awesome sponge cake with strawberries.  Cha Su Bao are stuffed with cha su and have just the right amount of honey baked on top.  I recently tried a coconut macaroon cookie on a whim and was delighted - crisp (unlike most macaroons) and not to sweet.
author: Michele L.

description: After years of loving their cakes, I got the cakes(tiered cake and the groom's cake) for my wedding from here and they were GREAT and below my budget!!! Only $319 for the three tier and half sheet cake with delivery. I have been and will be a fan of Sunset Bakery and their cakes!
author: Tiffanie M.

description: We called ahead at last minute to get a birthday cake. No problems on the ordering side of things. Sunset Bakery is fantastic! We parked near the enterance and were greeted warmly as we walked in. Nobody is perfect, and Sunset had the name on the cake slightly wrong ~ one letter off ~ but they fixed it quickly, nicely and with no notice that the error even existed. Great customer service. Friendly.
author: Barbie D.

description: Wow, their cakes are delicious here. I like it because it's not too sweet, and the frosting is light (I hate heavy frosting-like the ones you find on safeway cakes). We always buy our cakes from this place. Their always really nice to me, not like the other Chinese bakeries around the sunset area. Though, the only thing is that parking sucks here (for me). I never could find any parking space when I come, hence I have to park in someones driveway and peak out the store every 5 seconds to make sure I don't get a ticket or whatever.
author: Vivian C.

description: Great pork bun and other Chinese bau.  Great for grab and go while waiting for the bus.  Also, Connie and Leena can be pretty chatty and they are so lively and energetic.  Great place for bau.
author: Goose C.

description:
Absolutely impressed.

After reading the reviews here, I decided to get a half-sheet for a friend's birthday, and was not disappointed in the least. Lots of options, ready when you need it, and yummy!

We got a chocolate cake, banana and strawberry filling, with white cream on top. It was divine and everyone else thought so too. Nothing was left!
author: Lili E.

description:
This place has the worst customer service! Even for a Chinese retailer. Really. 

The first time we went there, a young Chinese woman/girl was working behind the counter. Since she was Chinese, I spoke to her in Chinese, even though my own Chinese is not the best. Well, she refused to respond in Chinese even though it was obvious she understood what I said because she responded to all my questions perfectly...in English. I. Can't. Stand. People. Like. Her. Oh, she never cracked a smile. 

The second and definitely last time I went there was earlier today with my two kids. Behind the counter was an elderly Chinese woman. I spoke to her in Cantonese. That was not the problem this time. Instead she was downright rude. I asked her a question about one of the cakes I was not familiar with. Instead of answering me, she came from behind the counter and told me to "you watch your kids!" because they were touching their help-yourself paper coffee cups that they stupidly placed at children's height. Then she went back to the counter and rang me up: $6.80. I handed her $7 and waited for my change. And waited. It never came. She then came around the counter again and said that I had to pay for the two paper cups my kids grabbed! At 10 cents each! Do the math. Yep, that adds up to $7. How convenient. Coincidence? I think not. I gave her a piece of my mind: "I can't believe you charged me for paper cups. These are kids. Five and two year olds! If it were me, an adult, I could see that. But two toddlers?!!" She said it was not her decision, but that it was the boss' policy. Had I not already grabbed my purchase, I would have left it there on the counter and taken my money. On our way out, I emphatically threw the cups into their garbage can and said "Don't count on my business again!!" And walked out. Yes, a little dramatic, but I think my message got through. The two elderly customers sitting there stopped and looked. The cooks in the back came out and looked. Another customer walking in wondered what was all the commotion. Oh, the elderly woman never cracked a smile. Must be the younger woman's mom. Sourpuss face must be hereditary. 

This was my first review on Yelp. Why doesn't Yelp allow zero stars!? That's what Sunshit Bakery would have received. 

Now that I got that out of my system, I feel much better.
author: S H.

description: I had an orientation for school for which everyone was supposed to bring some sort of food...well since I just moved here, and financial aid has not come in yet, I decided that buying a ton of groceries and making something myself was not an option...SO I searched for bakeries on Yelp and came across this one. The Strawberry Cake came highly recommended so I decided to buy it and take it to the orientation. Now keep in mind that I HATE cake, but everyone else seems to like it so I thought it would be a good choice. I was forced to try it at the event, and it was.....AMAZING!!!!! It was light and fluffy and sweet but not overwhelming. This bakery also had a ton of other pastries that I will have to go back and try now. The staff was super friendly and parking was easy. All in all, this place is great!!!
author: Meghan C.

description: This place has the best Strawberry Cake or Banana Cake I have ever had - I always pickup birthday cakes for the family at this bakery.  I don't know how they do it, but the cake is very fluffy and the frosting is not super sweet and is done just right.  The writing on the cake is less than desired, but who really cares about the writing??
author: Jennifer S.

description:
My husband and I had a short engagement and wedding cakes were the last thing on our mind between relocating and reception planning. At first, I was a bit sad that all of the SF specialty wedding cake shops were booked for our wedding day, but it turned out to be a blessing in disguise because that led us to Sunset Bakery. I didn't expect to order a wedding cake from the same bakery that provided my favorite childhood breakfast staple (pineapple buns, mmm) but the price was right, the light cake suited my guests' palates, and they needed only two weeks' notice! True, they're not famous for elaborate designs, but I saw a cake in their repertoire that I liked and provided the ribbon for decoration. I had my florist make a floral a cake topper, too.

There was a little hitch in the process because the bakery outsources cake delivery and the deliverymen initially refused to stop in front of a downtown venue for fear of accumulating parking tickets. However, the bakers were gracious in staying in touch with me and finding another deliveryman who eventually conceded to make the delivery. 

One minor drawback for me was that the fresh fruit selection for the cake filling is limited (no mango :(). But still, a great experience.
author: Ellen Y.

description: Bought a cake last minute for my sister here. Wow was it good! The cake was light and spongy and the frosting was light and just a tad sweet, not too sweet where you have to scoop it off to the side of your cake plate and leave it there while you eat the rest of the cake. You know what I mean? You know who you are, we've all done it! The best part is the service. I walked in there thinking that I would have to speak in my not so good chinese, but the gals at the counter were bilingual. Since it was last minute, I was thinking that there would be slim pickings..... not at all! There were actually cakes in the frig to the right when you walk in. There were large square cakes to smaller round cakes to choose from. At first I chose the smallest cake that they had to offer, but the gal at the counter mentioned that if I bought a size bigger, it would only be like 4 dollars more. Now what a deal! I couldn't pass up a bigger cake for a better price, now could I?  I chose the cake with mixed fruit on the inside and they whisked it back to the baker to have them put the saying that I had chosen and POOF, I was out the door with cake in hand. To me the hardest thing was my decision on which cake to choose from, so be prepared to either pick some sort of fruit filled cake, which is super fresh or a chocolate type cake. If it was my choice, I would have chosen a chocolate cake, but alas the cake wasn't for me. So hint hint to whoever reads this and is planning to get a cake for me...... get me the chocolate one.
author: carebear l.

description: This is based on my recent experience with this bakery. I would have given this place 5 stars but let me explain. My family have been ordering our cakes & pies here for at least 20 years. When I recently ordered a cake to be picked at 4pm sometime during a weekend, the girl I spoke to said, "Well, we close at 5pm, if you're late...oh well." I was really appalled by her response. There is a better way to ask customers to be on time.  When I got there, the same girl was working the counter. She showed no enthusiasm at all.  I hear this place is under new management but c'mon now...don't you think you should uphold the same customer service as the previous owners?! So with the sucky customer service plus the fact that it's hard to find parking in this area (my family and I never cared about this before), I'm not sure if I'll ever come here again.  If they want to keep their customers, they should go teach their staff some customer service skills.  My brother can attest to this...he recently bought something from this place. After he sends me a texts and says,"You're right, they are mean."
author: Rose E.

description: the standard for light and airy fresh strawberry and whipped cream cake.  worth the drive and risking tickets by double-parking!
author: Jen P.

description: They have the best paper wrapped sponge cake. It's always best when it is fresh and if you need it in the morning for something  you have to place an order the day before. Their sponge cake is what makes their cake so great. It's not sweet at all and the texture is nice.
author: Jen C.

description: on and off visits throughout its lifespan, a delightful visit on a rainy saturday with mouthwatering custard tarts, cakes can be hit or miss, if you like your cakes unsweetened and careful attention paid to, you have my blessing, the cute and caring counterstaff really make this place to shop ... yeah i like this place
author: tim y.

description:
i think this is one of the best places as far as cakes go. i don't like really sweet icing, or that fondant stuff you can't even eat. if you're like me then this place might be for you.

the cake is really light also, i think i could eat a whole cake to myself if i really wanted to. cakes are pretty cheap and you can call ahead to reserve something.

their pastries are pretty decent, especially considering the prices. if you need a quick and cheap snack or a good cake, this is where i'd go.
author: Adam L.

description: My wife and I got our wedding cake at Sunset Bakery.  The cake looked fabulous and was delicious.  Our guests were thoroughly impressed by the appearance and taste of the cake.  We chose a mocha cake with fresh strawberry filling.  The cake was moist, light, and airy.  The strawberries were sweet and mouth-wateringly delicious and smothered in whipped cream.  The frosting was fresh and sweet but not overly sweet.  We have come to know the owner and his family and have found them to be such pleasant and generous people.  I highly recommend this bakery!!
author: Andrew W.

description: My family has bought various baked items from Sunset Bakery for years and never had any issues.  I would recommend the cocktail buns and yummy dinner rolls.  I'm a fan of their fruit tarts and pumpkin pies (for Thanksgiving).  The pies are popular during holidays so it is best to call in your order.
author: c v.

description: bf always buys me my surprise birthday cake from here, so he got me hooked onto it.=) they are especially good because the cake is so soft and fluffy.. i dont eat the frosting though so i scrape that off, but theres plenty of fruits in the mixed fruits cake. and the prices are great!
author: christy w.

description: Best and most fluffiest and lightest spongecake I've ever had...and the cheapest at 80 cents.
author: Lan L.

description: We were over at the Sunset bakery the other day asking for information about wedding cakes based on the good reviews here.  However, it was a disappointment that the two young employees were not very helpful at all.  They seemed to be more interested in talking on the phone or eating their lunch than answering our questions.  We were pretty much put off by their indifference and have decided to go with a bakery with better customer service.  Their price is very competitive but with the employees' attitudes, we could not justify giving them our business.  We hope that other people have a better experience with this bakery.
author: har g.

description: i don't personally visit this bakery much, but their cakes are delicious [not too sugary, with the right amount of icing, filling, etc] and reasonably priced. other items i have no idea about except that their buns and other pastries are rather cheap.
author: Court L.

description: Really good cake.  Light, and more savory than sweet.  Based on YELP went there last week to get a cake for a friend's birthday.  Went back this week because I want to impress visitors by having delicious cake.   Staff is friendly.  As far as I know they only take cash.
author: Joshua M.

description:
one of the best strawberry shortcake cakes around!  light, fluffy and the icing isn't too rich.  and all at a reasonable price!  
but parking can be a challenge...
author: Jenny M.

description: I don't really care about 'hi, how are you today...bla,bla' manners when it gets to shopping. However, I rather find it annoying. BUT, the lady who works there was so rude and taking my order took her almost an hour, since she is the only one who works with customers. While trying to finalize my order and get all the desired explanations, I received only jokes towards me in Chinese.  I found myself not knowing how to react (To say something  nasty in my first language? No way). By the way, I was not ordering three buns or a roll, but a wedding cake for which she insisted me to pay immediately in cash, making some nonsense excuse for not taking only a deposit.  I'm a sugar junkie and they just killed my curiosity for the cake....And I finally ordered the cake, which came out exactly how I expected: nothing special, ok,  the frosting wasn't tasty. When it got to talking to them about the delivery, I simply gave my phone to my husband who, after a short conversation felt the same way I had felt before- at the edge to get a nerve break. The only good thing about this experience was the price of the cake!
author: Snezana A.

description: **1/2 stars:  try the custard cake.  it's a 3-layered vanilla cake that's fluffy, not sickly sweet, along with the pudding-like custard filling, makes for a fine afternoon tea treat.
author: meijan w.

description: My husband wanted a vanilla layer cake with coconut frosting for his birthday party.  Simple, right?  Well, no.  I called many fancy bakeries, offering taste bud-numbing, over-the-top creations like triple fudge caramel cake for exorbitant prices.  When I told them what I wanted, they treated my request for a simple vanilla cake with coconut frosting with disdain.  So I called Sunset Bakery.  The person who took my order listened to what I wanted and said, "No problem."  The cake was ready at the scheduled pick-up time, and was an incredible value.  Most importantly, my husband and all of our party guests raved about the cake.  Moist, incredibly light vanilla cake.  Perfect frosting.  It wasn't too sweet, tasted like fresh cream, and had flakes of moist, chewy coconut.  As a bonus, the cake was bordered with fresh strawberry and tangerine slices.  I'm using Sunset Bakery from now on for all of our entertaining needs.
author: A W.
